commit_message:
Update astara image build

We've finalized renaming and can now rename this config variable in the
job.

Also, update the publisher to allow publishing artifacts built for
master as well as stable branches.

Change-Id: I67a5285dca115b5a3a0e9a9c1f6d0fab1827e859

commit_message:
Database purge deleted spec

This spec details the abiltiy to cleanly purge "deleted" rows.
This provides confirmed data destruction beyond the current
archive_deleted_rows functionality.

Implements: blueprint database-purge
Change-Id: I271948b0d29a98f84d4757494c35be9218094f2d

commit_message:
[Rally] add new job for verification

Currently we have only one job to check that `rally verify` command works
well. It launches small number of tempest tests, which is not enought to
check changes in generation tempest config, so this patch adds new job
which will launch full tempest run when code related to verification is
changed in rally.

Change-Id: Idb0e6f955e23055a2d98295d2628a30973ecb115

commit_message:
Make the openstackci-beaker job voting

This change runs any time an infra/puppet-* module changes, to prevent
openstackci from breaking.

Change-Id: I644c9a5c89491f43e20313928953724b8a546ae4

commit_message:
Change pidfile location in uwsgi_nailgun.yaml template

pid files should be placed in a standard directory.

In our case nailgun service (systemd) requires that file
to be placed in /var/run directory.

Blueprint: master-on-centos7

Compatible with CentOS6 master node

Change-Id: I97a2b6aac9f96628d41253bedc23b4667c60ac1d

subject: Add -constraints for CI jobs
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-22 01:04:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add -constraints for CI jobs

This adds the constraints factor to the base section and duplicates
the sections required for CI with -constraints as tox does not
currently support factors in sections.  Work towards enabling factor
support in sections is currently stalled, as such we will need to
duplicate sections adding -constraints to facilitate running sections
with the constrained install_command.

Implements Blueprint: Requirements-Management

commit_message:
Add -constraints for CI jobs

This adds the constraints factor to the base section and duplicates
the sections required for CI with -constraints as tox does not
currently support factors in sections.  Work towards enabling factor
support in sections is currently stalled, as such we will need to
duplicate sections adding -constraints to facilitate running sections
with the constrained install_command.

Implements Blueprint: Requirements-Management

Change-Id: Ibbeabdf65c1405bf4d35e21375636dcc4583bbc2

commit_message:
Add instance name as parameter to CLI (metadata-*)

Allow CLI to take instance name as well as instance id for sub-commands
where instance can be specified. This commit addresses the metadata-*
commands that were excluded previously.

Affected sub-commands are:
    metadata-create
    metadata-delete
    metadata-list
    metadata-show
    metadata-update
    metadata-edit

Unit tests were added to make sure passing in an instance object
for the affected sub-commands also works.

Note: This implementation depends on the corresponding spec being
approved.  See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/175042

Change-Id: If8620ff36cd0bfa472d33337e554f00948c1451e
Partially implements: blueprint add-instance-name-to-cli

commit_message:
Don't drop ARP table jump during OVS rewiring

The previous OVS ARP spoofing code was dropping the rule to jump to
the ARP protection table each time it was called. This call was
unnecessary since the majority of port updates are not turning
off port security.

This patch adjusts the logic to only drop the jump rule if port-sec
is disabled or if it is a network port. The existing functional tests
ensure that connectivity works as expected.

Closes-Bug: #1520013
Change-Id: I7b396d758c2d4c7e1004257d432b210bf3ee5c66

commit_message:
[Ironic] Configure neutron-server only on controllers

Since new role Ironic added and requires OVS agent, condition of
neutron-server installations should be changed.

In case if ironic node is not combined with controller, it has no
neutron-server.

Change-Id: I2a9e2e327bcad347561bc944f91c4fbf279d8428

commit_message:
Disable ceph's job for kilo in glance_store

The ceph job has been failing lately and the last 2 attempts to fix it
were unsuccessful. This patch disables the job for now until we manage
to get it back to work.

Change-Id: Ie8a6bcf19a0373cc38d48c22a8e3eefef8005c6f

commit_message:
Liberty: Remove the example spec

Since Liberty cycle feature proposals are complete, we do not need this
example spec. It shows up on
http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/glance-specs/ and can create
confusion.

This commit removes the example spec. Merge proposals can still use the
template as a reference.

Change-Id: I1f0a890c7cdce0d48ebe000d7069386ce040bd10

commit_message:
Remove extra { on zuul-git-branch-prep

I noticed this just as part of reviewing
I2e926b55f8b9def4b7e238110c528bd2e5c82128 ; this will put {{ into the
shell-script which is invalid syntax.

zuul-git-branch-prep was added with
Ib3f4844c1203f8a3890d9e5d91347d4507b5d08b but seems unused.  We might
just want to get rid of it.

Change-Id: I3a65f419770675cc7cb510f23c03be8284a3dc8f

commit_message:
Remove unneeded zuul arg manipulation

Now that zuul-cloner does not require these arguments (and will
default to simply checking out the master branch), remove them
from the job definition for simplicity.

Change-Id: I59319d37b943be17b7b409dd182f3d21ce8762de

commit_message:
V1: Fix bad dates returning 500

Currently if you send a bad date format such as 'foo', as one of the
settable dates ie. `created_at`, `updated_at` and `deleted_at` it will
cause the server to return a 500.

This change means that the server will respond with a 400 and a helpful
message.

Change-Id: Ib342ef6640efbc3d76c4bafc622ccfdfa3d16ade
Closes-Bug: 1483649

commit_message:
Implement new Liberty default for Neutron rpc_workers

The default number of Neutron rpc_workers has changed in Liberty from 0
to 1. This patches changes the default to this value, as the default of 0
results in a very high number of workers.

Implements: blueprint gate-split
Implements: blueprint liberty-release
Change-Id: I31ebbbbb10e260b2895aa5d55d3716136dbffd90

commit_message:
Implement tunable Horizon/Apache processes/threads overrides

This patch introduces an override for the number of Apache processes
and threads for Horizon:
 - horizon_wsgi_processes
 - horizon_wsgi_threads

The values may be set in /etc/openstack_deploy/user_variables.yml
and if they are unset, half the number of available vCPU's will be
used instead.

Implements: blueprint gate-split
Change-Id: Ie608ef66b8979a466e72c6085c9afa6ab95cc6ff

subject: Implement tunable heat api and engine worker overrides
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-25 19:48:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Implement tunable heat api and engine worker overrides

This patch introduces an override for the number of Heat engine and
Heat API workers:
 - heat_engine_workers
 - heat_api_workers

The values may be set in /etc/openstack_deploy/user_variables.yml
and if they are unset, half the number of available vCPU's will be

commit_message:
Implement tunable heat api and engine worker overrides

This patch introduces an override for the number of Heat engine and
Heat API workers:
 - heat_engine_workers
 - heat_api_workers

The values may be set in /etc/openstack_deploy/user_variables.yml
and if they are unset, half the number of available vCPU's will be
used instead.

Implements: blueprint gate-split
Change-Id: I1ecb4951fe8336d9ef86ef9d5c8c21105a299096

commit_message:
Enable inner requirements parsing during requirements check job

In terms of oslo.messaging initiative, it was decided to split
requirements into per-driver requirements, but current check script
can only parse explicit dependecies but not the inner once.
Example:
current valid variant:  komby=>2.5.0
current invalid variant: -r requirements.d/base.txt

Also, check script looks over *requirements*.txt files and
project's root and 'tools/' directory, so it was decided to
extend lookup directories.

Here's what updated script shows when executing it over
oslo.messaging dependent patchset:

git rev-parse HEAD
git remote update
git checkout remotes/origin/master
git checkout 9344eb3fe4959cc6e5642570375182f1f4157601
git clone https://review.openstack.org/p/openstack/requirements \
 --branch master --depth 1 /tmp/tmp5c8fc4/requirements
git rev-parse HEAD
requirements git sha: c8279d16a59285b8ffb56cb59aec929171fde9f4
Updated requirements match openstack/requirements.

Change-Id: I893f9a1c259157bc6e6829fe34067ede365c15b7
Can be tested with: I9708322308655cbb4832fec1351ea1215e6e11ef

commit_message:
doc: Restructure 'Requirements' section

The section on 'requirements.txt' files is rather detailed. This
particular section, given its location in the document, should provide
an overview of what pbr does RE: requirements files without going into
implementation specifics. These implementation specifics should instead
be covered in the 'Usage' section.

Rework the existing 'Requirements' sub-section within the 'What It
Does' section such that it only provides a high-level overview. Add the
more detailed explanation of this feature as a new sub-section within
the 'Usage' section.

Change-Id: Id1d6954e647baae93ee0148445946d78d9d36ca5
Partial-bug: #1509376

commit_message:
doc: Restructure 'Usage' section

The usage section isn't very clear: it assumes a lot of setuptools
knowledge on behalf of the user when one of the goals is to abstract
away this knowledge.

Begin reworking it by restructuring the existing content. Move the
'setup.py' sub-section to the top, as it's arguably the most important
file, then slightly rework the 'setup.cfg' sub-section.

Change-Id: I85e136e8817e294ce9b536b4f3ee7f262cc3cd2c
Partial-bug: #1509376

commit_message:
Change installation of python-mistralclient in the gates

After this commit 'gate-mistral-devstack-dsvm' will install
mistral from commit and latest released python-mistralclient,
'gate-mistralclient-devstack-dsvm' will install python-mistralclient
from commit and mistral from master.

Partially implements: blueprint mistral-making-dsvm-gates-voting

Change-Id: Ia0c9bb84412b39c571565db1f00188c4e0db71fc

subject: The result of tenant list may be unpredictable
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-26 06:28:45.000000000', 'files': ['cloudkitty/orchestrator.py'], 'message': 'The result of tenant list may be unpredictable

A problem like bug 1512560 existed in orchestrator when determinate
which tenants will be rated in the next period:
The process method in orchestrator include the following processing
logic: modify (remove some items) the sequence (self._tenants) being
iterated over in the loop, which may cause unpredictable result.
This patch fixed this problem as the same way as solving bug 1512560.

Change-Id: Id148c5a0a1ab0290cfff02d9121badcb7f4e6ac7
Closes-Bug: #1520068
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
The result of tenant list may be unpredictable

A problem like bug 1512560 existed in orchestrator when determinate
which tenants will be rated in the next period:
The process method in orchestrator include the following processing
logic: modify (remove some items) the sequence (self._tenants) being
iterated over in the loop, which may cause unpredictable result.
This patch fixed this problem as the same way as solving bug 1512560.

Change-Id: Id148c5a0a1ab0290cfff02d9121badcb7f4e6ac7
Closes-Bug: #1520068

[{'created': '2014-11-06 15:32:42.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/scripts/prepare_node.sh'], 'message': "Make unbound and zuul optional in prepare_node.sh

Unbound and zuul installation sections looks optional for the following reasons:
*   in case there is a properly configured DNS server located inside LAN
    an additional component like 'unbound' isn't required.
*   If you are running internal infra then it's likely that you don't need
    zuul installed on your worker nodes.

Change-Id: Ia3dbb4aea8f2fc7b97b15d1ac472228517b9302d
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Make unbound and zuul optional in prepare_node.sh

Unbound and zuul installation sections looks optional for the following reasons:
*   in case there is a properly configured DNS server located inside LAN
    an additional component like 'unbound' isn't required.
*   If you are running internal infra then it's likely that you don't need
    zuul installed on your worker nodes.

Change-Id: Ia3dbb4aea8f2fc7b97b15d1ac472228517b9302d

documentation section.

commit_message:
Update some steps in quickstart-aio.rst

Add some comments to let user look up the latest
tag first, then execute command "git checkout <latest-tag>".

Backport notes:
This has been modified from the original patch to ensure that
the page references the right branch.

(cherry picked from commit 07a6cacd2a6d19fce29b43c63b352c5c45d97c4b)

commit_message:
Update some steps in quickstart-aio.rst

Add some comments to let user look up the latest
tag first, then execute command "git checkout <latest-tag>".

Backport notes:
This has been modified from the original patch to ensure that
the page references the right branch.

commit_message:
remove elasticsearch method delete_by_query

The elasticsearch method delete_by_query has been removed
from the api because deprecated since elasticsearch 1.7

see:
https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/1.7/docs-delete-by-query.html

Change-Id: Ib21708c7147f4202eb7e4dba7a64adbc192d94af
(cherry picked from commit 0dcacd908e5ed86fd4a2942a8bad8208b6422eff)

commit_message:
[verify] add ability to turn off compare in job

For `full` mode launching verification two times can be redundant as well as
compare verifications.

Change-Id: I2107fa05d9f6c3db4ff27bbf431d5268346dd23b

commit_message:
Share tftpboot directory for ironic-conductor and pxe

Node configs and images placed by ironic-conductor should be available
from tftp server.

/tftpboot directory should be shared between ironic-pxe and ironic-conductor
containers.

Closes-bug: #1520293
Change-Id: Iee6a73534ac38c4386a53b82fd3c567b8a971beb

commit_message:
re-implement thread safe fnmatch

fnmatch is not thread safe for versions <= 2.7.9. We have used
it in some places without any lock for concurrency scenario. This patch
re-implements a thread safe match() which is very similar to fnmatch by
using its translate function.

Change-Id: I4b6c2ea72841201519144eb09ecf8c82b16b6143
ref: https://hg.python.org/cpython/rev/fe12c34c39eb
Closes-Bug: #1519767

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
increase number of wsgi threads

most databases default to allow ~100 connections at least.
oslo.messaging defaults to 64 threads per worker. we should bump
up the thread count to be inline with other databases and openstack

Change-Id: I2a72bfc3739c714f9ce6787b7a21c0d8ed09d037

subject: clean up integration test urls
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-25 23:19:09.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': 'clean up integration test urls

the endpoints for aodh, ceilometer and gnocchi end with trailing
slash. because of that, our tests are calling <endpoint>//<path>.
this works but is technically incorrect. this patch cleans it up.

Change-Id: I187ea35b6158ac86bc2c4f19597c37e0b75cf2e4
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
clean up integration test urls

the endpoints for aodh, ceilometer and gnocchi end with trailing
slash. because of that, our tests are calling <endpoint>//<path>.
this works but is technically incorrect. this patch cleans it up.

Change-Id: I187ea35b6158ac86bc2c4f19597c37e0b75cf2e4

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-25 09:45:45.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Drop python-openstacksdk from requirements

The package has been renamed to 'openstacksdk' which also appears in the
requirements file. This doesn't make sense. 'python-openstacksdk' is a
pretty old version of the same thing, thus should be removed.

Change-Id: I22305666f59cdac346c4b23468385881f7f36b88
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Drop python-openstacksdk from requirements

The package has been renamed to 'openstacksdk' which also appears in the
requirements file. This doesn't make sense. 'python-openstacksdk' is a
pretty old version of the same thing, thus should be removed.

Change-Id: I22305666f59cdac346c4b23468385881f7f36b88

commit_message:
Fix typos in documents and comments

Fix typos detected by toolkit misspellings.
* pip install misspellings
* git ls-files | grep -v locale | misspellings -f -

Change-Id: I17d97d73a2820eb210ad8b596be5d88f256e4625

commit_message:
Remove `extras` from token data

In the Kilo release we opted to remove the `extras` field from
the token body in favor of well defined APIs. We can now remove
it as it has been 2 cycles.

implements bp: removed-as-of-mitaka

Change-Id: I612d3d0dbe35b858928f6f44f26af26cf690a897

commit_message:
Fix incomprehensible releasenotes

Fix incorrect usage of RST for releasenotes, and also cleanup how we use
reno for these releasenotes. When they were orginally pushed, how reno
formatted things wasn't clear to the original author of these releasnotes,
resulting in suboptimal releasenotes. This cleans things up in a more
presentable format for all consumers of the releasenotes.

This commit is made directly to stable/liberty because these releasenotes
do not exist in master.

Closes-Bug: #1519912
Closes-Bug: #1519915

Change-Id: Iea07d53067f5ad7a5282982cb12a834c786a75b9
Signed-off-by: Kyle Mestery <mestery@mestery.com>

Always unmount the volume after attach.

commit_message:
Abstract a helper function for server.xxx() tests.

The test cases for server.xxx() are all the same, with one or more faked servers.
So use a helper function to reduce code duplicate.

Change-Id: I660c7731e2de8bf4d815b414a621d8d9ca6d5a8b
Implements: blueprint osc-unit-test-framework-improvement

commit_message:
Remove hardcoded LDAP group schema from emulated enabled mix-in

The emulated enabled mix-in uses hard-coded LDAP schema for the
group objectclass and membership attributes.  This patch makes the
mix-in optionally use the LDAP group configuration settings.

Conflicts:
        keystone/common/ldap/core.py
        keystone/tests/unit/test_backend_ldap.py

Change-Id: I5ed9d552ec140f83578398fd29e2130ebf827662
Closes-Bug: #1515302
(cherry picked from commit e465de5b44ffb1da65eab77ba7c81d1c0ced367f)

subject: Workaround requests/urllib connection leaks
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2813, 'name': 'Mehdi Abaakouk', 'email': 'sileht@sileht.net', 'username': 'sileht'}, {'_account_id': 6537, 'name': 'gordon chung', 'email': 'gord@live.ca', 'username': 'chungg'}, {'_account_id': 6924, 'name': 'Pradeep Kilambi', 'email': 'pkilambi@redhat.com', 'username': 'pkilambi'}, {'_account_id': 11564, 'name': 'Chris Dent', 'email': 'cdent@anticdent.org', 'username': 'chdent'}, {'_account_id': 15843, 'name': 'Intel Hardware-Meters CI', 'email': 'ipmi-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'ipmici'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-23 11:11:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Workaround requests/urllib connection leaks

When a ConnectionError occurs, python-requests <= 2.8.0
and/or urllib3 <= 1.11, connections are not returned to
the pool.

This change adds a CustomHTTPAdapter to workaround this
issue.

This HTTPAdapter doesn't trigger theses urllib3 issues.
This HTTPAdapter workaround this by enforcing preloading
of the response. When enabled, urllib3 releases the connection
to the pool immediatly after its usage, and doesn't trigger the
issue.

By enforcing preloading, this break some requests
features (like stream) that we didn't use into our GnocchiClient

Upstream bugs:

* https://github.com/shazow/urllib3/issues/659
* https://github.com/shazow/urllib3/issues/651
* https://github.com/shazow/urllib3/issues/644
* https://github.com/kennethreitz/requests/issues/2687

We could remove this when requests 2.8.0 will be released

Closes-bug: #1498823
Change-Id: I7d40ade927b834909e230613777cba1f7537c0ec
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-09-23 12:28:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Workaround requests/urllib connection leaks

When a ConnectionError occurs, python-requests <= 2.8.0
and/or urllib3 <= 1.11, connections are not returned to
the pool.

This change adds a CustomHTTPAdapter to workaround this
issue.

This HTTPAdapter doesn't trigger theses urllib3 issues.
This HTTPAdapter workaround this by enforcing preloading
of the response. When enabled, urllib3 releases the connection
to the pool immediatly after its usage, and doesn't trigger the
issue.

By enforcing preloading, this break some requests
features (like stream) that we didn't use into our GnocchiClient

Upstream bugs:

* https://github.com/shazow/urllib3/issues/659
* https://github.com/shazow/urllib3/issues/651

", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-09-23 12:36:41.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/unit/dispatcher/test_gnocchi.py', 'ceilometer/dispatcher/gnocchi_client.py'], 'message': "Workaround requests/urllib connection leaks

and/or urllib3 <= 1.11, connections are not returned to

This HTTPAdapter doesn't trigger theses urllib3 issues.
This HTTPAdapter workaround this by enforcing preloading
of the response. When enabled, urllib3 releases the connection

commit_message:
Workaround requests/urllib connection leaks

When a ConnectionError occurs, python-requests <= 2.8.0
and/or urllib3 <= 1.11, connections are not returned to
the pool.

This change adds a CustomHTTPAdapter to workaround this
issue.

This HTTPAdapter doesn't trigger theses urllib3 issues.
This HTTPAdapter workaround this by enforcing preloading
of the response. When enabled, urllib3 releases the connection
to the pool immediately after its usage, and doesn't trigger the
issue.

By enforcing preloading, this break some requests
features (like stream) that we didn't use into our GnocchiClient

Upstream bugs:

* https://github.com/shazow/urllib3/issues/659
* https://github.com/shazow/urllib3/issues/651
* https://github.com/shazow/urllib3/issues/644
* https://github.com/kennethreitz/requests/issues/2687

We could remove this when requests 2.8.0 will be released

Closes-bug: #1498823
Change-Id: I7d40ade927b834909e230613777cba1f7537c0ec

commit_message:
Move setup_servers_mock() to class TestServer.

This function will be used in almost every test case.
So move it to the base class to avoid define it each
time a test case is added.

Change-Id: I060b54f0935b42a85042ad217d851fea649ec8d9
Implements: blueprint osc-unit-test-framework-improvement

commit_message:
Tenant networking support for Ironic driver.

Currently, Ironic only works on a flat network shared between control
plane and tenants. There's an ongoing effort to allow for arbitrary
networks to be connected to Ironic nodes in various configurations. Some
changes in Nova are required to support this effort.

Implements: blueprint ironic-networks-support
Change-Id: Ifa3fc9c07f2518285d26bc8e9caed404301e6ad7

Tests to cover create mirror

This is a tests to run on ci to
verify fuel-createmirror behaviour.
Tests to check network issues are skipped
because of need to choose right network
tool.

commit_message:
Bug fix while editing actions with missing keys

If a key is not present in the database, the panel failed to open the modal
windows for edition, this fix that by using the dict.get()

(cherry picked from commit 3cce1e3d3bb806e791e20535521b1903bdacc158)

Change-Id: I3c18da72cb4a0a5caf6c52388b7f41bc6903e55b

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-17 19:42:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'WIP: Enable updating the MAC address on a port

Allowing a client to update a MAC address of a port is required for the
physical function passthrough use-case.

Change-Id: If11e4e1f3d728e67e21c6f606559385e9c0c4267
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-18 13:12:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'WIP: Enable updating the MAC address on a port

Allowing a client to update a MAC address of a port is required for the
physical function passthrough use-case.

Related-bug: #1500993

Change-Id: If11e4e1f3d728e67e21c6f606559385e9c0c4267
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-11-18 13:34:24.000000000', 'files': ['neutronclient/tests/unit/test_cli20_port.py', 'neutronclient/neutron/v2_0/port.py'], 'message': "DO NOT MERGE: Testing updating the MAC address on a port

As it turns out, this isn't actually required unless we want to allow
the user to update MAC addrs from the command line. At the moment, only
nova needs to be able to update MAC addrs for the PF passthrough effort
and and it does not use the commands but builds up it's own request
bodies.

Related-bug: #1500993

Change-Id: If11e4e1f3d728e67e21c6f606559385e9c0c4267
", 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
DO NOT MERGE: Testing updating the MAC address on a port

As it turns out, this isn't actually required unless we want to allow
the user to update MAC addrs from the command line. At the moment, only
nova needs to be able to update MAC addrs for the PF passthrough effort
and and it does not use the commands but builds up it's own request
bodies.

Related-bug: #1500993

Change-Id: If11e4e1f3d728e67e21c6f606559385e9c0c4267

commit_message:
Convergence: Load resource stack with correct template

When loading a resource, load the stack with template of the resource.
Appropriate stack needs to be assigned to resource(resource.stack), else
resource actions will fail.

Co-Authored-By: Anant Patil <anant.patil@hp.com>
Partial-Bug: #1512343

Change-Id: Ic4526152c8fd027049514b71554036321a61efd2

commit_message:
Fix Example of net-config filename

Example of net-config file is added by
commit 0d42f01f68cbe4e480c51b63271bd3bdb41d8021,
and file is assumed etc/murano/netconfig.yaml.sample
in commit message. But netconfig.yaml.samle was added.

This patch renames netconfig.yaml.samle to netconfig.yaml.sample.

Change-Id: I9d86b95bc54e2b6d6124b699e9cf256aeb067efa
Closes-Bug: #1515904
(cherry picked from commit c76feacebc57c8f6a9d7908cb7c311186144f09a)

getting stack outputs.

commit_message:
Set network template for node during upgrade

When a node is moved (upgraded) from one cluster to another, its network
template is from now on updated accordingly.

Change-Id: I076b084283a5a221ac23e9c895ce61389018694c
Closes-Bug: #1492744

APIImpact

to heat service. Methods takes specified stack and resolves
output in specific format.

commit_message:
Allign requirements to Liberty

In order to work properly in the same environment with Liberty
release of OpenStack, Fuel Client must follow Global Requirements
not only by version but also by order.

This patch performs a soft-sync from glonal-requirements.

Closes-bug: #1499659
Change-Id: Ia0e43b446cdd48e69ad871470930f22874720474

commit_message:
Use $::os_service_default where is possible

This is a second part of switching to $::os_service_default fact.
Switch to $::os_service_default all params, which are possible
to use with $::os_service_default fact.

Related-bug: #1515273

commit_message:
Switch Murano to use $::os_service_default fact

This patch switches Murano to use $::os_service_default fact as
default value for params instead of using deplicated defaults from
project

Change-Id: Ie5d669bffd34dc77191155623fab466481aede34
Related-bug: #1515273

commit_message:
Log error if a local device not identified in replicator

Example:
* Different port in config and in ring file.
* Running daemon on server not in ring file.
In both cases replication daemon is running but nothing is replicated.
Error log helps to distinguish a local device can't be identified.

Closes-Bug: 1508228
Change-Id: I99351b7d9946f250b7750df91c13d09352a145ce

fix db_init number of replicas

for the number-of-replicas alse when that parameter is not
provided on the command line.

    to a new volume.

commit_message:
XtremIO fix create CG from src flow

Fix a bug during volume creation with CG,
    that prevented the volume from being added to the CG on the array.
Query array snapshots names for CG snapshot before copying them
    to a new volume.
Add unittest for create_cg_from_src.

liberty-backport-potential

Change-Id: Ieb76cc3e039e4c5495d00a8703c79930bc8b4df1
Closes-Bug: #1512682

[autohelp] misc fixes

- swift: read from docbook on liberty
- swift: ignore :ref: directives
- swift: remove a bogus sys.exit(0)

commit_message:
XtremIO fix attach readonly bug

* Remove the access_mode from connection_info and let the manager decide
on the access mode.
* add a test to make sure access_mode won't be added in the future

liberty-backport-potential

Change-Id: I3378776928a5dc328958fe17a1c99af2bff88e8d
Closes-Bug: 1516365

commit_message:
XtremIO fix attach readonly bug

* Remove the access_mode from connection_info and let the manager decide
on the access mode.
* add a test to make sure access_mode won't be added in the future

liberty-backport-potential

Change-Id: I1584b27ff0c14e54f1d1efb2310d25454995c50a
Closes-Bug: 1516365

commit_message:
Have versioned_writes use reverse listings

This will reduce the overhead required for versioned containers in terms
of memory, back-end requests, and wall time.

Change-Id: I156216a14141db547de3cae1dcd5315ae31eaac2

commit_message:
Test for pacemaker resources when disk is full

 Adding test case for covering filling root situation on primary controller.
 Add health_check_all, health_check_ha to ostf_base_actions.py.
 Move health_check to ostf_base_actions.py

 Closes-Bug: #1500446

Change-Id: I17055527e99c72b790544e7baef997eab20258e0

commit_message:
Update ostf service for CentOS7

Update spec file to support CentOS7:
* make argparse conditional
* remove upper bounds

Add systemd unit for ostf.

Blueprint: master-on-centos7

Compatible with CentOS6 master node

Change-Id: Ib9bd6319893e4559e91302738f290d4d0d968ffd

commit_message:
remove unnecessary FakeLog class in test code

The FakeLog defined in keystoneclient/tests/unit/test_http.py isn't
used anywhere. This patch removes it.

fixtures package already provides a FakeLogger for us to use,
so we really don't need to maintain a private implementation,
this patch removes FakeLog in test_auth_token_middleware and replaces
it with fixtures.FakeLogger

Change-Id: I6aaf761a9676edf5bd799d22b79497be1d423e7c

Workaround for sahara module:
sahara::logging class can't be used because of
https://github.com/openstack/puppet-sahara/blob/master/manifests/init.pp#L371
It leads to duplicate declaration of this class. That's why
sahara::logging::default_log_levels class was implemented.

Change-Id: Ia8665eaf526158760a5420e7813c7367cc457c0c

sahara::logging class can't be used because of
https://github.com/openstack/puppet-sahara/blob/master/manifests/init.pp#L371
It leads to duplicate declaration of this class. That's why

", 'number': 6}, {'created': '2015-11-20 16:41:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Enable oslo.messaging debug for OpenStack components

We should have oslo.messaging debug enabled
when OpenStack log debug is set to true.
Make default_log_levels configurable through globals.yaml.

NOTE: sahara::logging class can't be used because of
https://github.com/openstack/puppet-sahara/blob/master/manifests/init.pp#L371
It leads to duplicate declaration of this class. That's why
default_log_levels parameter for sahara::logging is configured
through globals.yaml. After new puppet modules sync with upstream
we will get the same problem for another openstack components.
It will be fixed in the way as it's done for sahara now.

Closes-bug: #1509090

Change-Id: Ia8665eaf526158760a5420e7813c7367cc457c0c

commit_message:
Enable oslo.messaging debug for OpenStack components

We should have oslo.messaging debug enabled
when OpenStack log debug is set to true.
Make default_log_levels configurable through globals.yaml.

NOTE: sahara::logging class can't be used because of
https://github.com/openstack/puppet-sahara/blob/master/manifests/init.pp#L371
It leads to duplicate declaration of this class. That's why
default_log_levels parameter for sahara::logging is configured
through globals.yaml. After new puppet modules sync with upstream
we will get the same problem for another openstack components.
It will be fixed in the way as it's done for sahara now.

Closes-bug: #1509090

Change-Id: Ia8665eaf526158760a5420e7813c7367cc457c0c

commit_message:
Introduced fuel-mirror

Avaliable commands:
- create - Creates a new local mirrors.
  fuel-mirror create --input ubuntu.yaml

- apply - Applies local mirrors for Fuel-environments.
  fuel-mirror apply --input centos.yaml -e "ENV1"

Change-Id: I6cbf4e581a93b47cf75fb3c89aa1020a352784c8
Closes-Bug: #1487077
Implements: blueprint refactor-local-mirror-scripts

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-23 17:01:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[WIP] Use correct method to handle services behind SSL proxy

Adds "X-Forwarded-Proto=https" to all connections that pass through
haproxy on public network. This fixes an issue where keystone cannot
issue tokens while the public endpoint is not accessible.

Additionally, removed public_endpoint parameter from keystone, which
forces all internal connections to be public endpoint connections.

Change-Id: I1ec881248af79bce054d3a9713fc8a6205eca7b8
Closes-Bug: #1508489

', 'number': 5}, {'created': '2015-11-24 16:02:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Use correct method to handle services behind SSL proxy

Adds "X-Forwarded-Proto=https" to all connections that pass through
haproxy on public network. This fixes an issue where keystone cannot
issue tokens while the public endpoint is not accessible.

Additionally, removed public_endpoint parameter from keystone, which
forces all internal connections to be public endpoint connections.

Changed priority of murano-api and murano_rabbitmq from 180 and 185
to 190 and 191, respectively, so they does not overlap with ironic
haproxy rules.

New spec and noop tests for haproxy service configuration

commit_message:
Use correct method to handle services behind SSL proxy

Adds "X-Forwarded-Proto=https" to all connections that pass through
haproxy on public network. This fixes an issue where keystone cannot
issue tokens while the public endpoint is not accessible.

Additionally, removed public_endpoint parameter from keystone, which
forces all internal connections to be public endpoint connections.

Changed priority of murano-api and murano_rabbitmq from 180 and 185
to 190 and 191, respectively, so they does not overlap with ironic
haproxy rules.

New spec and noop tests for haproxy service configuration

Change-Id: I1ec881248af79bce054d3a9713fc8a6205eca7b8
Closes-Bug: #1508489

commit_message:
Fix import of devstack functions for common CI script

Commit [1] moved common logic for CI hooks to separate file, but it
depends on some devstack functions, that should be "sourced" in this
common file. So, this common file works in manila hooks, because they
import devstack functions separately, but it will not work if some other
scripts use it and do not import devstack functions.

[1] I94514405628ab8337d1f4153e431f064614e3596

Change-Id: I919fea046e556d601a7680ea9bac16c1a9b7343c
Closes-Bug: #1519028

commit_message:
Unified gerrit acls for openstack/fuel-plugin-* projects

Since every newly created fuel-plugin-* uses 'fuel-plugins-ci' group
for 'label-Verified' acls, this change refactors the old ones, to make it
unified.

Change-Id: I99b29f8b2e5b46474123457bed2380c5fcca68a2
Closes-Bug: #1497191

commit_message:
Deprecate l3-agent router_id option

L3-agent router_id option has been defined in order to associate a
l3-agent to a specific router when use_namespaces=False. The option
use_namespaces has been removed in Mitaka, so router_id option is no
longer needed and can be deprecated in order to prepare its removal in N
cycle.

Closes-Bug: #1518776
Change-Id: Id79499ccbf3ea69ca4cd7e4b2f812f6dbc0406e0

Loading core components via fixture

This patch is part of works for implementation new mechanism of
compatibility between components in Fuel. Changes provide core
components for releases in openstack.yaml

Implements: blueprint component-registry

commit_message:
Fix neutron ml2 configuration for Ironic

vxlan should be allowed in tenant_network_types because it used in
tunnel_types.
Allow all flat networks when ironic enabled.

TrivialFix
Change-Id: I39b2fbf26bb4c9047e7c3ea5ca7749ae113e4ed8

commit_message:
Add interruptable time.sleep() to utils

Built-in time.sleep is not possible to interrupt.

Add interruptable_sleep to utils. Enable it by running
few times time.sleep() with smaller time.

Rewrite dummy scenario in way that allow us to interrupt it
during execution by runner timeout.

Add dummy scenarios to the rally job with rps and constant runner
to check that thread in which they are executed would terminated
by runner timeout.

Co-Authored-By: Roman Vasilets <rvasilets@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sergey Scripnick <sskripnick@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I416200b0e71eb533cd552406bc791831540bcc2e

commit_message:
Use snapshots_client from tempest-lib

Below files have been migrated to tempest-lib-

 * snapshots_client.py: I7854f7e080de9e819a1fae0d2de5d3aee111505a
 * snapshots.py: I7854f7e080de9e819a1fae0d2de5d3aee111505a
 * test_snapshots_client.py: I7854f7e080de9e819a1fae0d2de5d3aee111505a

Now Tempest-lib provides above as stable interface
so Tempest should start using those from lib and remove its own copy.

Change-Id: Id28c615534235c345e31b895a77a53ceac4af1a4

subject: Changed J2 filters for renderspec
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-16 09:59:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Changed J2 filters for renderspec

 * As were discussed at last irc meetintg, made transofrmations for:
   pypackname_normalize -> pkg_src
   license_normalize    -> pkg_lic
 * Why pkg_src instead of py2pkg or pypi - because spec could contain not only python* as dependencies

Change-Id: I670e557f3558bdfe96905bfdebc2d2b51dbc1d6c
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-16 10:31:34.000000000', 'files': ['renderspec/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Changed J2 filters for renderspec

 * As were discussed at last irc meetintg, made transofrmations for:
   pypackname_normalize -> pkg_src
   license_normalize    -> pkg_license
 * Why pkg_src instead of py2pkg or pypi - because spec could contain not only python* as dependencies

Change-Id: I670e557f3558bdfe96905bfdebc2d2b51dbc1d6c
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Changed J2 filters for renderspec

 * As were discussed at last irc meetintg, made transofrmations for:
   pypackname_normalize -> pkg_src
   license_normalize    -> pkg_license
 * Why pkg_src instead of py2pkg or pypi - because spec could contain not only python* as dependencies

Change-Id: I670e557f3558bdfe96905bfdebc2d2b51dbc1d6c

commit_message:
bootstrap: make a well formed fuel-bootstrap-image.conf

EXTRA_DEB_REPOS is supposed to be a pipe (`|') separated list of APT URLs.

Blueprint: master-on-centos7

Compatible with CentOS6 master node

Closes-Bug: #1516962

Change-Id: I115218ae94da75eda382a36c80a2cbdea83accfb

subject: Remove the two different auth profiles
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-20 23:25:11.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/glance/tasks/ceph.yml', 'ansible/roles/cinder/tasks/ceph.yml', 'ansible/roles/nova/tasks/ceph.yml'], 'message': 'Remove the two different auth profiles

Ceph can function just fine generating the keys before the pools have
been created so we can apply the proper permissions to the auth string
ahead of time. This allows us to not require additional steps to add a
cache tier on the fly in the future.

Change-Id: I8214c567fb7c337f95d908c5699d1da922bfa1a6
Closes-Bug: #1518475
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove the two different auth profiles

Ceph can function just fine generating the keys before the pools have
been created so we can apply the proper permissions to the auth string
ahead of time. This allows us to not require additional steps to add a
cache tier on the fly in the future.

Change-Id: I8214c567fb7c337f95d908c5699d1da922bfa1a6
Closes-Bug: #1518475

commit_message:
Fix senlin update verb

Senlin service uses 'PATCH' for update commands. This wasn't set before
in the resource types.

Change-Id: I5bd0b909af7e3c1d129fa910d954123255831104

commit_message:
Dump shotgun log at the end of snapshot creation

Shotgun dumps /var/log/shotgun.log as normal part of the snapshot, but
it fills it in as the snapshot is created, which resulted in dumping
shotgun log split in half.

This patch makes shotgun dump it's own logs at the end of snapshot
creation process, just before compressing it.

Change-Id: Ie3e9737b2f430fd2f6ff3083b216f0ee62681c97
Closes-Bug: #1496842

We should use V3 params when initializing Keystone V3 clients.
So this patch is intended to fix it.

commit_message:
V1: Stop id changes after the image creation

Currently in v1 if someone tries to update the ID after the image is
created it will cause a 500 to be returned (or if updating to the same
ID a 200). This now returns a 403.

ApiImpact

Change-Id: Ibb40632f027b2b84f88aaf0a971a0f18de350187
Closes-Bug: 1483353
Closes-Bug: 1483688
(cherry picked from commit be0a27082b53c85f47d3c82ef852f285d975f9b8)

commit_message:
[V3] Rename get_group to show_group

[GET /resources] methods should be "list_<resource name>s"
or "show_<resource name>", so this patch applies the rule
to groups client.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Ia6c83f9bad2684c61e694e52244ea54c98d9d070

commit_message:
Integration of Ceilometer in Watcher

In current implementation is not easy to use ceilometer.
Watcher must query metrics from the Telemetry v2 API to allow an easiest integration with OpenStack
components (especially devstack).

blueprint telemetry-integration
Change-Id: Ide515472f1d160925d9f4aabf48c96dea4f6bc05

commit_message:
Remove oslo.context dependency

There's no good reason to depend on this library. The
RequestContextSerializer has never been used by any of the other
OpenStack project, and they all implement it in they're own various way
for their own context support.

Change-Id: If91b3655c9413228ff51345cd2c5112e647f8567

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix broken ACL tests

In keystonemiddleware 2.0.0 the token cache keys are sha256 hashes of the
token key. For versions of keystonemiddleware < 2.0.0 this is not the
case, so this patch is changing the FakeMemcache class to support both.

Change-Id: I14f6a47437ca861d3135bedbfe2b3a54de211182
Closes-Bug: #1466405
(cherry picked from commit 13bcebcaf390697d04a69855d8e50013d0312e1d)

commit_message:
[V3] Make groups_client use **kwargs

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.
This patch makes groups_client use **kwargs.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I558453a64247835b117f4612064a381ad84f3513

commit_message:
Modify baremetal network settings

After recent network configuration updates in Fuel,the location of
baremetal gateway and baremetal range parameterswas changed
so these changes should be reflected in fuel-qa.
Also, the line added to avoid using tagged VLAN for baremetal network.

Change-Id: I7be88e4dbff97576e609d36cb5cc8311aeddb328
Closes-Bug: #1519802

It is valid to have two of the same DIB element in different element

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Dont error on duplicate elements

It is valid to have two of the same DIB element in different element
dirs (DIB precedence rules apply).

Change-Id: I731cc8a0f5bfeda8f17a78c33b9f44062323a361

commit_message:
Add support for Neutron L3 HA feature

Neutron L3 HA feature adds an ability to schedule a virtual router to at least
two L3 agents and an opportunity to establish connection faster after L3 agent
failover than router rescheduling.

Blueprint: neutron-vrrp-deployment
Change-Id: If26ee7d7a56fccd3f0dc67792fd6c9807f07a8c2

commit_message:
Code style changes

Mass fix:
1. shadow builtins in locals
2. binary operators on new line
3. import class as lowercase (not readable type of object in namespace)

API not changed.

Change-Id: Ia171e466b502d95aa96ff4801eb37d528d659b64

commit_message:
Fix task state for YAQL error in subflow output

If evaluation of YAQL in the subworkflow output, the corresponding task
will be stuck in a RUNNING state. Also, error in the state_info of the
subworkflow does not bubble up to the parent workflow.

Change-Id: I13e9f389ad923a43caee41072979eeba578d0f3e
Closes-Bug: #1518506

commit_message:
Port key manager to Python 3

* Replace text.decode('hex') with binascii.unhexlify(text)
* test_barbican: base64 string is a bytes string
* tests-py3.txt: add keymgr tests

Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: Icc19fa354603857b259458b858e27c5bdd600360

commit_message:
Fail job if SELinux denials are found

Scans the audit.log files for SELinux denials at the end of
devtest runs. If denials are found, it returns 1 as the exit
code.

Merge this patch only after all SELinux denials have been
squashed and appropriate notifications are sent out to list.

Change-Id: I56b0a0db9014427acf738aa755c7815f52b9db0c

commit_message:
Add --force-yes option for install-packages

  --force-yes option is required for installing packages
  for example from non official mirrors (for example local mirrors)
  when they can't be authenticated

Change-Id: Id93041f4c99e6bd0cbf1ea4eeec6987e33bd7613

commit_message:
Check all controllers for alive HTTP proxy

Try to authorize in Keystone using HTTP proxy
on all online controllers.
If Keystone is not available via all proxies
then raise 'SetProxy' exception.
If authorization failed via all alive proxies
then raise 'InvalidCredentials' exception.

Change-Id: I62681f3eb26c23edba3683842860c19eb4ddd4b6
Closes-bug: #1515516

commit_message:
Use ironic-agent for deployment and introspection

This patch updates the overcloud image build step so
that we use the ironic IPA agent ramdisk for both
deployment and introspection. By doing this we
can skip building 2 other ramdisks (deployment
and "discovery") entirely. This should save
both CI time and simplify the number of steps
involved in bootstrapping images.

Change-Id: I76e8657007ce4972b7fb905bf941c9bc851b6465

commit_message:
telemetry: don't share queue between projects

Telemetry integration job is valid only since gnocchi stable/1.1.
Also there are no reason to link all projects into the same
zuul change queue.

This change renames the job name to not the same zuul change queue
and set the correct branches names for the gnocchi jobs.

Change-Id: Iaafa2ca00cfd0d61d53d510f7f45ad1c5bd3fdcf

commit_message:
Enable heat_enable_wait_condition by default

Set heat_enable_wait_condition to True by the default. Also
disable that in gate-sahara-dsvm-scenario-nova-heat job.

Related-bug: 1516784

Change-Id: If2e8a4ad010d516f65e2f9ae4449d70cc30d8e44

commit_message:
Support of Spark EDP in Ambari plugin

Start support Spark EDP jobs in Ambari plugin.
Also added sparkPi job to test this support.

Current issues:
 * Spark with Swift doesn't work

Change-Id: I2374d387054efa20876fbcee46ede038e0f3d520
Partially-implements-blueprint: hdp-22-support

commit_message:
Update some steps in quickstart-aio.rst

Add some comments to let user look up the latest
tag first, then execute command "git checkout <latest-tag>".

Update old kilo stable branch to the latest liberty stable
branch when you execute command "git clone -b ${BRANCH} ${REPO}
/opt/openstack-ansible".

Change-Id: I0597fbcc3950a99639174ab6398222fd3905caab

commit_message:
Change multi-backend configuration to a list

There is a limit for 2 backends in tempest to be tested.
Changing the backend names to a list will allow to test more
backends and run tests on all configured backends
Changing tests to support N backends.

The changes :
Change-Id: I9e1391e86777cd5ebdbff616588b1e1c7bf6ff1f

commit_message:
Fix flock wait timeout in crontask

In flock from util-linux 2.23.2 wait timeout cannot be zero

Blueprint: master-on-centos7

Compatible with CentOS6 master node

Closes-Bug: #1517436

commit_message:
Use Tempest-lib's compute services_client

Compute services_client has been migrated to
tempest-lib- I29684ec61023650bd2bb3a76b708bac24608f6c0

Now Tempest-lib provides this client as stable interface so Tempest
should start using this from lib and remove its own copy.
Also remove its unit tests.

This commit makes Tempest to use compute services_client
from Tempest-lib.

Change-Id: I7498e25136ad790cec158d5b654dbbdbd8146753

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-24 14:19:48.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "tox: pass TEMPEST_CONFIG_DIR envvar into api target environment

Currently, API job skips all tests because TEMPEST_CONFIG_DIR is not set
properly. The environment variable was hardcoded to
/opt/stack/tempest/etc before, and since that's the location for tempest
configuration files that was used in gate, it worked fine there.

But after we were forced to remove the hardcoded value from the file due
to regression in tox 2.2.0+ (If3742b6eabe295a5aaeb4901c55909a70c451698),
it was neither hardcoded, nor passed from the external gate environment.

Note that since tox 2.0.0, the tool does not pass all envvars into tox
targets, but require explicit specification of the list of variables
that should be allowed into the target environment, using passenv
directive.

So that's what the patch does: it allows TEMPEST_CONFIG_DIR to get into
api tox target, which should be enough to make the API job avoid
skipping all tests.

Users are still required to set TEMPEST_CONFIG_DIR variable locally if
they want to execute the suite locally.

Closes-Bug: #1518632
Change-Id: Ia7dcc6785390a6012c7ba16a14573aa44f2b6fb5
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
tox: pass TEMPEST_CONFIG_DIR envvar into api target environment

Currently, API job skips all tests because TEMPEST_CONFIG_DIR is not set
properly. The environment variable was hardcoded to
/opt/stack/tempest/etc before, and since that's the location for tempest
configuration files that was used in gate, it worked fine there.

But after we were forced to remove the hardcoded value from the file due
to regression in tox 2.2.0+ (If3742b6eabe295a5aaeb4901c55909a70c451698),
it was neither hardcoded, nor passed from the external gate environment.

Note that since tox 2.0.0, the tool does not pass all envvars into tox
targets, but require explicit specification of the list of variables
that should be allowed into the target environment, using passenv
directive.

So that's what the patch does: it allows TEMPEST_CONFIG_DIR to get into
api tox target, which should be enough to make the API job avoid
skipping all tests.

Users are still required to set TEMPEST_CONFIG_DIR variable locally if
they want to execute the suite locally.

Closes-Bug: #1518632
Change-Id: Ia7dcc6785390a6012c7ba16a14573aa44f2b6fb5

[{'created': '2015-11-25 09:32:05.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/static/horizon/js/horizon.tables.js', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/hypervisors/tables.py'], 'message': "Stop using naturalSort in hypervisors table

In some situations, JS's naturalSort sorts hypervisor_hostname in
an unusual order. For example, this is a usually ordered list:

  east-01, east-02, west-01, west-02

while the result made by naturalSort is:

  east-01, west-01, east-02, west-02

Also, this is inconsistent with the other tables as they are using
datatable's default sort. Actually, the default sort does natural
ordering to numbers in text. So we can use the default sort instead
of naturalSort without a problem.

for naturalSort were removed.

Closes-Bug: #1480563
(cherry picked from commit 3067584f7102751cf69566696b250254ab6e076c)
Change-Id: I8df3ff72a33d194a5b6bc1692aac7878a611ae44
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Stop using naturalSort in hypervisors table

In some situations, JS's naturalSort sorts hypervisor_hostname in
an unusual order. For example, this is a usually ordered list:

  east-01, east-02, west-01, west-02

while the result made by naturalSort is:

  east-01, west-01, east-02, west-02

Also, this is inconsistent with the other tables as they are using
datatable's default sort. Actually, the default sort does natural
ordering to numbers in text. So we can use the default sort instead
of naturalSort without a problem.

As the hypervisor table is the only user of naturalSort, all stuff
for naturalSort were removed.

Closes-Bug: #1480563
(cherry picked from commit 3067584f7102751cf69566696b250254ab6e076c)
Change-Id: I8df3ff72a33d194a5b6bc1692aac7878a611ae44

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-25 22:05:49.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py'], 'message': 'Use SAVEPOINT transaction instead of a nested transaction

Currently _allocate_vr_id[1] uses the pattern:

 for count in range(...):
   try:
     with context.session.begin(substransactions=True):
       ...
   except db_exc.DBDuplicateEntry:
     # pass

Any db_exc.DBDuplicateEntry error raised will not break the
subtransaction but the whole transaction and the next iteration will
crash because we can no more use the transaction.

This change replaces the subtransaction by a SAVEPOINT transaction: if
a db_exc.DBDuplicateEntry error is raised the whole transaction is not
broken and the next iteration will not crash because of transaction
status.

[1] neutron.db.l3_hamode

Change-Id: I5bc5bd3e7ebc7fbd848c426b6d52bf44983e7aec
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Use SAVEPOINT transaction instead of a nested transaction

Currently _allocate_vr_id[1] uses the pattern:

 for count in range(...):
   try:
     with context.session.begin(substransactions=True):
       ...
   except db_exc.DBDuplicateEntry:
     # pass

Any db_exc.DBDuplicateEntry error raised will not break the
subtransaction but the whole transaction and the next iteration will
crash because we can no more use the transaction.

This change replaces the subtransaction by a SAVEPOINT transaction: if
a db_exc.DBDuplicateEntry error is raised the whole transaction is not
broken and the next iteration will not crash because of transaction
status.

[1] neutron.db.l3_hamode

Change-Id: I5bc5bd3e7ebc7fbd848c426b6d52bf44983e7aec

commit_message:
Use hiera_hash() instead hiera() for some hashes.

The following hiera lookups should always be hiera_hash:
* network_scheme

Removed array lookup for nameservers

dns_nameservers is now a normal priority lookup, not array
Removed unused novanetwork_parameters lookup

Change-Id: I57c5a41a8c302fdb2d8e9ad7773688705e1b1f4e

commit_message:
Don't use Pacemaker for Neutron agents on compute nodes

- Neutron agents should be never deployed as Pacemaker resources on compute
  nodes.Ignore *_agent_ha values if related tasks are executed on compute nodes
- Add metadata-agent task for compute nodes as it's required for DVR

Change-Id: I2d1852dbfb295a840e8ec2396e9667acf2ee6117
Closes-bug: 1515244

commit_message:
Fix wrong use of os_package_type

https://review.openstack.org/241615 introduced a bug in
Red Hat based distros, with the consequence of collectstatic
and compress being never done. This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I69a6fa9ade86904f2301e057d9bd9800e905b8d3
Closes-Bug: #1519715

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-25 16:57:48.000000000', 'files': ['etc/ironic/ironic.conf.sample', 'ironic/common/config_generator/generator.py'], 'message': 'Add deprecated config info in ironic.conf.sample

ironic.conf.sample shows deprecated configs that have been
moved to different groups and renamed. Deprecated configs are
not being indicated if they moved to a different group but
did not get renamed.

This fixes it to show all deprecated configs.

ironic.conf.sample was also updated to reflect other changes
that have occurred since the last update.

Change-Id: I608892a9735ecffc2c374330a4f0ee4e12ab6011
Fixes-Bug: #1519886
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add deprecated config info in ironic.conf.sample

ironic.conf.sample shows deprecated configs that have been
moved to different groups and renamed. Deprecated configs are
not being indicated if they moved to a different group but
did not get renamed.

This fixes it to show all deprecated configs.

ironic.conf.sample was also updated to reflect other changes
that have occurred since the last update.

Change-Id: I608892a9735ecffc2c374330a4f0ee4e12ab6011
Fixes-Bug: #1519886

commit_message:
Add net_vip_map_external to be used for an external balancer

Changes VipMap into a new NetVipMap resource which defaults to
being the same as the 'old' VipMap. An environment file can be
used to map NetVipMap instead to the net_vip_map_external.yaml
which allows for passing in explicit Virtual IP addresses.

It also ensures that references to the Virtual IPs are gathered
from the VipMap resource and allows for an empty ControlPlaneIP
parameter in the neutron port templates where it can be.

Co-Authored-By: Giulio Fidente <gfidente@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ifad32e18f12b9997e3f89e4afe3ebc4c30e14a86

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-07-30 10:56:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[WIP] Delete HA network when last HA router is deleted

Currently when the last HA router of a tenant is deleted the HA network
belonging to this tenant is not removed. While running tempest aganist an
OpenStack setup where tenant VLANs (with small VLAN range) is used we hit
the limits are tempest tests start to fail as we cannot create new networks.
This patch addresses this issue by deleting the HA network when the last HA
router is deleted for the tenant.

Pending:
  1. Check if its race proof.
  2. Test cases.

Appreciate any early feedback. Thanks.

Closes-Bug: #1367157
Change-Id: I1d50b973aed4148857ac3d2bbee0d38e2e199783
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-07-31 14:17:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[WIP] Delete HA network when last HA router is deleted

Currently when the last HA router of a tenant is deleted the HA network
belonging to this tenant is not removed. While running tempest aganist an
OpenStack setup where tenant VLANs (with small VLAN range) is used we hit
the limits are tempest tests start to fail as we cannot create new networks.
This patch addresses this issue by deleting the HA network when the last HA
router is deleted for the tenant.

Pending:
  1. Check if its race proof.
  2. Test cases.

The implementation in this patchset is different to patchset1.
Appreciate any comments/feedback about the recommended approach.

commit_message:
Delete HA network when last HA router is deleted

Currently when the last HA router of a tenant is deleted the HA network
belonging to this tenant is not removed. While running tempest aganist an
OpenStack setup where tenant VLANs (with small VLAN range) is used we hit
the limits are tempest tests start to fail as we cannot create new networks.
This patch addresses this issue by deleting the HA network when the last HA
router is deleted for the tenant.

Closes-Bug: #1367157

Co-Authored-By: Ann Kamyshnikova<akamyshnikova@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I1d50b973aed4148857ac3d2bbee0d38e2e199783

commit_message:
Fixed some unit test issue.

1) 'output' property has been added to WF_EXECS.
2) In py34,'message' attrubute has been removed
   from exception class. So 'args[0]' has been
   used instead of 'message'.

Partially-Implements: blueprint mistral-py3

Change-Id: I626de3d9305f4f8d52bbeaf2b1094c9e96563cae
(cherry picked from commit 7852684d0f01162864122c1eb8d2166a0c65f0be)

commit_message:
Rename db.api methods to match models' names

There are some methods in db.api and db.sqlalchemy.api that do not match
the snake case conversion of the corresponding model.

For example, we have volume_type and volume_types methods in db.api,
only the later is correct since the model name is VolumeTypes.

We also have consistencygroup_ methods that should really be called
consistency_group_.

This patch fixes this incoherent naming.

Related-Bug: #1490944
Related-Bug: #1238093
Related-Bug: #1490946
Related-Bug: #1469659
Change-Id: I8449e554a38c392b735b1ef2d8787f979b4c49ec

commit_message:
WIP: Service State Reporting

With an Active-Active configuration we'll have multiple services sending
heartbeats to the DB and we need to make sure that we will not "break"
when 2 nodes from the same cluster of them try to modify the same row in
the DB.

To do this we use the compare-and-swap functionality.

This is part of a PoC for HA A-A

Change-Id: I91ed4d57ff2c3efef4628ad8380e0806bd41e619

commit_message:
Preserve usage and reservations on quota deletion

Currently we are deleting quota usage and reservations when we delete
quotas for tenant or user, which should not be happening, as only quota
limits should be deleted.

This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: I8440e94fe61fb90298a72fe8d5630e1cca5e95d2
Closes-Bug: #1410032

commit_message:
WIP: Start/Stop coordinator with Services

To make use of the coordinator on the different services we need to
start and stop it together with the services.

This patch adds start and stop method calls in API, Volume and Backup
nodes.

This is part of a PoC for HA A-A

Change-Id: Ifb42310d2be02e718a8da1708cc6560124d701c2

commit_message:
WIP: TaskFlow locks

This patch adds 2 new tasks for resource lock management in Workflows:
LockResourcesTask and UnlockResourcesTask.

It also changes the locking of the volume creation task to make use of
these new Tasks.

This is part of a PoC for HA A-A

Change-Id: I588a1fe3d3ef2b41e1e1322034a7a45634d8f920

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-07-26 15:22:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'WIP: Cleanup stuck jobs

To allow multiple nodes to work using the same job queue we need to make
some changes, one of those changes is how Volume Nodes start.

On non Active-Active configurations we can easily detect stuck jobs just
by looking at the DB and seeing which jobs were just in progress.

But now that we have multiple nodes accessing using the same queue we
can no longer be sure at start up if those resources that were in
progress are stuck or they are in the middle of processing.

We will know once we try to access them, by the job that was requeued
when the other node failed or by another operation that has acquired the
lock.

If we acquire a lock for a resource and an operation was in progress on
that resource we know that either a node failed leaving it stuck or we
have a bug in the code that made that operation to fail.

This patch illustrates how we can recover resources from those
situations. This should be done to any resource we acquire (even for
reading), so maybe we should look into create a lock_and_clean
decorator/method.

This is part of a PoC for HA A-A.

Change-Id: Ica2347be41e49225fb2e3335e6997abbe5a9c054

when the other node failed or by another operation that has acquired the
lock.

If we acquire a lock for a resource and an operation was in progress on
that resource we know that either a node failed leaving it stuck or we
have a bug in the code that made that operation to fail.

This patch illustrates how we can recover resources from those
situations. This should be done to any resource we acquire (even for
reading), so maybe we should look into create a lock_and_clean
decorator/method.

This is part of a PoC for HA A-A.

Change-Id: Ica2347be41e49225fb2e3335e6997abbe5a9c054
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
WIP: Cleanup stuck jobs

To allow multiple nodes to work using the same job queue we need to make
some changes, one of those changes is how Volume Nodes start.

On non Active-Active configurations we can easily detect stuck jobs just
by looking at the DB and seeing which jobs were just in progress.

But now that we have multiple nodes accessing using the same queue we
can no longer be sure at start up if those resources that were in
progress are stuck or they are in the middle of processing.

We will know once we try to access them, by the job that was requeued
when the other node failed or by another operation that has acquired the
lock.

If we acquire a lock for a resource and an operation was in progress on
that resource we know that either a node failed leaving it stuck or we
have a bug in the code that made that operation to fail.

This patch illustrates how we can recover resources from those
situations. This should be done to any resource we acquire (even for
reading), so maybe we should look into create a lock_and_clean
decorator/method.

This is part of a PoC for HA A-A.

Change-Id: Ica2347be41e49225fb2e3335e6997abbe5a9c054

commit_message:
WIP: Acknowledge post execution

To allow multiple nodes to work using the same job queue we need to make
some changes, one of those changes is acknowledging jobs/messages after
the Volume Node has completed its execution.

This patch changes the way we acknowledge jobs, instead of acknowledging
them as soon as we receive them we acknowledge them after we have
completed them.

This ispart of a PoC for HA A-A.

commit_message:
WIP: Add queued/requested statuses

To allow multiple nodes to work using the same job queue we need to make
some changes, one of those changes is adding new requested/queued
statuses to writing operations so we can tell when a job has just been
queued or if a node had already begun working on it.

This is part of a PoC for HA A-A.

Change-Id: I9ca6c8a4f006fb17798b7f2bc71e233bf1bf6616

commit_message:
releases: fix release diff for multiple deliverables

If there are multiple deliverables (like in neutron), we should make
sure we extract git hash for corresponding repo to extract diff between
previous and proposed versions.

Change-Id: I0e1210c8582ef87c099e45058b415a6e2346ed48

commit_message:
Add support of 'network_type' to standalone network plugin

StandaloneNetworkPlugin does not allow to configure network type,
but allows to configure segmentation ID.
So, to be able to use the latter correctly the former should be
supported too.

Change-Id: Idde140cebfc3b397bd5423d1b2fa3c8eeac08808
Closes-Bug: #1517987

commit_message:
Remove obsolete docimpact-group settings

With the recent jeepyb change, the default is now the repository name
for each repository. Therefore we can remove docimpact-group settings
that just reference the repository.

Change-Id: Ia7eb609767d427f1d5aa77516c56a51c895bea55
Depends-On: Ia280baecab8c8cabd3a084ca0914f41c66a5a466

commit_message:
enable sharev2 API capacity

* With the same interface as puppet-nova and puppet-cinder, create *_v2
  parameters.
* Keep v1 enabled by default for backward compatibility.
* Enable v2 by default because that's the new API since Juno release.

Change-Id: I81a5c6696708732a0de34225200f1242e988d0aa
Closes-Bug: #1512577

subject: Changed backporting of embedded Network object when backporting a FixedIP
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-07-03 14:36:06.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/objects/test_fixed_ip.py', 'nova/objects/fixed_ip.py'], 'message': 'Changed backporting of embedded Network object when backporting a FixedIP

When backporting a FixedIP object to the version 1.1 and less
we must backport Network object to version 1.1, because since
version 1.2, FixedIp object uses Network object v1.2.

Next two commits changed version of Network to v1.2,
but these commits does NOT dump FixedIp version:

275a165cf0e74112d7ec9addacb1f84d703977c8

ad6051bb5c2b62a0de6708cd2d7ac1e3cfd8f1d3

In fact we should have two new versions of FixedIp
between v1.1 and v1.2. Something like:

    class FixedIp():
    # Version 1.0: Initial version
    # Version 1.1: Added virtual_interface field
    # Version 1.1.1: Network <= 1.1
    # Version 1.1.2: Network <= 1.2
    # Version 1.2: Instance version 1.14

But we forgot about dumping when we changed Network version.

This backporting is needed when we use Icehouse compute.
In this case nova-conductor sends back
a FixedIP object of version 1.1 with an embedded Network
object of 1.2, Icehouse then incorrectly tries to backport
the FixedIP object again (as opposed to the Network object)
leading to a loop.

Related-Bug: #1408498

Change-Id: I5f9fad8228e23457a878e533a0e3d1faf54ee460
(cherry picked from commit 1714a124c2c928c74b33f247c92762090a808228)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Changed backporting of embedded Network object when backporting a FixedIP

When backporting a FixedIP object to the version 1.1 and less
we must backport Network object to version 1.1, because since
version 1.2, FixedIp object uses Network object v1.2.

Next two commits changed version of Network to v1.2,
but these commits does NOT dump FixedIp version:

275a165cf0e74112d7ec9addacb1f84d703977c8

ad6051bb5c2b62a0de6708cd2d7ac1e3cfd8f1d3

In fact we should have two new versions of FixedIp
between v1.1 and v1.2. Something like:

    class FixedIp():
    # Version 1.0: Initial version
    # Version 1.1: Added virtual_interface field
    # Version 1.1.1: Network <= 1.1
    # Version 1.1.2: Network <= 1.2
    # Version 1.2: Instance version 1.14

But we forgot about dumping when we changed Network version.

This backporting is needed when we use Icehouse compute.
In this case nova-conductor sends back
a FixedIP object of version 1.1 with an embedded Network
object of 1.2, Icehouse then incorrectly tries to backport
the FixedIP object again (as opposed to the Network object)
leading to a loop.

Related-Bug: #1408498

Change-Id: I5f9fad8228e23457a878e533a0e3d1faf54ee460
(cherry picked from commit 1714a124c2c928c74b33f247c92762090a808228)

commit_message:
Change setuptools requirement to <=18.5

The thing is that this requirement setuptools==18.5
becomes a part of fuel-nailgun RPM package.
The highest available version in mirror.fuel-infra.org
at the moment is python-setuptools-0.7.2 which
leads to the error pkg_resources.VersionConflict when
trying to load nailgun entry points using for example

load_entry_point('nailgun==8.0.0', 'console_scripts', 'nailgun_syncdb')

Console script entry points are used during the Fuel
master node deployment.

Change-Id: I1e9b326912ef2e60da87f89af89d3a7968818276
Related-Bug: #1519727
Closes-Bug: #1519990

commit_message:
Remove metrics for required aggregation args

When aggregation is done with a query, metrics are not required.
This change fixes that.

commit_message:
Gnocchi: Fix mapping between of stable branches

Gnocchi does independent releases, but gates on project that
does managed 6 month releases.

This change fixes the mapping between Gnocchi stable branches
other project branches.

subject: Ensure only one WF execution for every CT cycle
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-26 07:36:15.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/db/v2/api.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/services/test_trigger_service.py', 'mistral/services/periodic.py', 'mistral/db/v2/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/db/v2/test_sqlalchemy_db_api.py'], 'message': 'Ensure only one WF execution for every CT cycle

Make sure that only one engine starts a workflow for every cron
trigger cycle by checking the row count of the DML statements used
to update the cron trigger in the DB:
* Modify the update cron trigger to include a WHERE statement that
  verifies that no other engine already updated the cron trigger.
* Change the sqlachemy method used for deleting the cron trigger to be
  able to retrieve the row count of the deleted rows

Start the workflow execution only if the current engine was able to
update the cron trigger DB row

Change-Id: I9d3bec51844de218a46cf6ff53bedf9a00069e30
Closes-Bug: #1513548
(cherry picked from commit 7f9c0c62419888201e129282ba9d548d5fffdff5)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Ensure only one WF execution for every CT cycle

Make sure that only one engine starts a workflow for every cron
trigger cycle by checking the row count of the DML statements used
to update the cron trigger in the DB:
* Modify the update cron trigger to include a WHERE statement that
  verifies that no other engine already updated the cron trigger.
* Change the sqlachemy method used for deleting the cron trigger to be
  able to retrieve the row count of the deleted rows

Start the workflow execution only if the current engine was able to
update the cron trigger DB row

Change-Id: I9d3bec51844de218a46cf6ff53bedf9a00069e30
Closes-Bug: #1513548
(cherry picked from commit 7f9c0c62419888201e129282ba9d548d5fffdff5)

commit_message:
Accepts Group IDs from the IdP without domain

If group_ids is explicitly set in the saml2 assertion, add those ids to the
mapped_properties.

Change-Id: Idd3c218684b946603701de902d14f6a718acca40
Implements: blueprint federation-group-ids-mapped-without-domain-reference

commit_message:
[config-ref] Migrate ch_sharedfilesystemsconfigure.xml to RST

This patch includes a new extension to deal with inclusion of remote
files.

Change-Id: I56e523c0b41c3281f7c68ee4a1a332a19ff77833
Implements: blueprint config-ref-rst

commit_message:
Support insecure NAS security options in Quobyte

So far the nas_secure_file_* options have been hardcoded to
'true' in the Quobyte Cinder driver. This change
implements tests and a change to the set_nas_security_options
method that allows setting these options to false.

Implements: blueprint allow-insecure-conf-in-quobyte

Change-Id: Iffcafd843340059f9b35e9844939cdb004cafbea

commit_message:
Move oslo-incubator's scheduler module to cinder

oslo-incubator is ending its life and we should move remaining
dependencies from there to cinder namespace. This commit does so with
openstack.common.scheduler. Apart from that tests from oslo-incubator
repository are added.

Change-Id: I10d88c120c9c847826986483065f5493e91f89d6
Closes-Bug: 1519337

commit_message:
docs: add clarifications to move servers

This adds in some titles, to replace the bold text that simulated
heading. It also changes the text into use cases rather than actions.

It includes a some additions around:
* resource optimization use cases for live-migration
* data loss during evacuate
* downtime during resize
* clearer description of why a user would call shelve

This does not complete this doc, but should help improve the readability.

blueprint complete-todo-in-api-concept-doc

Change-Id: Ib2cf479c14a1c2f3b119ba7f549a00c9bd541cf9

commit_message:
Use Tempest-lib's compute security_groups_client

Compute security_groups_client has been migrated to
tempest-lib- I4076278b92e8166b52deaa0447047f7dc7a3934a

Now Tempest-lib provides this client as stable interface so Tempest
should start using this from lib and remove its own copy.
Also remove its unit tests.

This commit makes Tempest to use compute security_groups_client
from Tempest-lib.

Change-Id: I0deeaa2ed353cdd2eeb5f1954fa2bd7c92966e19

[{'created': '2015-11-09 17:48:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Ensure only one WF execution for every CT cycle

Make sure that only one engine starts a workflow for every cron

commit_message:
Ensure only one WF execution for every CT cycle

Make sure that only one engine starts a workflow for every cron
trigger cycle by checking the row count of the DML statements used
to update the cron trigger in the DB:
* Modify the update cron trigger to include a WHERE statement that
  verifies that no other engine already updated the cron trigger.
* Change the sqlachemy method used for deleting the cron trigger to be
  able to retrieve the row count of the deleted rows

Start the workflow execution only if the current engine was able to
update the cron trigger DB row

Change-Id: I9d3bec51844de218a46cf6ff53bedf9a00069e30
Closes-Bug: #1513548

commit_message:
Add a global var to maintain swarm version

Currently Swarm version in magnum are appear in multiple files.
It's not easy for us to maintain.

This patch add a global var to store swarm image and its version.
so that we can update swarm image more easy.

Change-Id: I3063ff4350f8e2f3c96b0bc3700ed509edad206b
Closes-Bug: #1515567

commit_message:
Update requirements according to global requirements

This is important because if we install tacker along with
other openstack components, this inconsistency will break
system.

Due to the upgrade of hacking, current codes violate many
new rules. These violations will be fixed in follow up
patches.

Author:    yong sheng gong <gong.yongsheng@99cloud.net>
Change-Id: Ib30d31ca804aebf43c02eb8247c718ab00629f6f
Closes-bug: 1516045

In py34, if NoneType object is compared to int value
it raises exception.
In unit test following type of error is occured.

Change-Id: Ibc7329824324edbe30976d460d389299824574ce

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Avoid comparision between "None" type and "int" type.

In py34, if NoneType object is compared to int value
it raises exception.
In unit test following type of error is occured.
"TypeError: unorderable types: NoneType() >= int()".

Change-Id: Ibc7329824324edbe30976d460d389299824574ce
Partially-Implements: blueprint mistral-py3
(cherry picked from commit 9dfd42e4504f08daf40b273a78d5d3df47be5eae)

commit_message:
Fix liberty periodic-stable jobs

Liberty's periodic-stable jobs need to checkout upper-constraints.
Switch to git-prepper that gets that for them.

commit_message:
No keystone Endpoint now gives a valid Error Message

When no valid keystone endpoint exist, EndpointNotFound exception
is raised with an error message

Change-Id: I75b00cb73b18bc19261c061e0ae217ef251f8853
Closes-Bug: #1208991

commit_message:
Fix Example of net-config filename

Example of net-config file is added by
commit 0d42f01f68cbe4e480c51b63271bd3bdb41d8021,
and file is assumed etc/murano/netconfig.yaml.sample
in commit message. But netconfig.yaml.samle was added.

This patch renames netconfig.yaml.samle to netconfig.yaml.sample.

Change-Id: I9d86b95bc54e2b6d6124b699e9cf256aeb067efa
Closes-Bug: #1515904

commit_message:
Avoid comparision between "None" type and "int" type.

In py34, if NoneType object is compared to int value
it raises exception.
In unit test following type of error is occured.
"TypeError: unorderable types: NoneType() >= int()".

Change-Id: Ibc7329824324edbe30976d460d389299824574ce
Partially-Implements: blueprint mistral-py3

commit_message:
Add 410 error code handling to REST client

- Add Gone exception which will raised if REST client hits
error code 410.
- Add unit tests for this exception.

Change-Id: I543fa80875d6de00845d5dc26bc07da2c1a7cd09

commit_message:
Fixed some unit test issue.

1) 'output' property has been added to WF_EXECS.
2) In py34,'message' attrubute has been removed
   from exception class. So 'args[0]' has been
   used instead of 'message'.

Partially-Implements: blueprint mistral-py3

Change-Id: I626de3d9305f4f8d52bbeaf2b1094c9e96563cae

commit_message:
Remove iso8601 dependency

Mistral does not import and use this module directly, no need to list
it in the requirements and no need to set debug level for this module.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I42d5661dce0d23777fc5801c20a3a7c86756007d
(cherry picked from commit 91f35ae9fb8d4efc042baa3028f7c7369219d280)
