revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-19 20:14:31.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/api.py'], 'message': 'Fix swap_volume for case without migration

Fix swap_volume so that even when a volume-migration does not
occur, the volumes don't get stuck in "attaching" and "detaching".
Previously the swap_volume was changed in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/101932 and
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/101933 to move the final
attach and detach logic to Cinder, however those changes only fix
the migration path.  This change calls Cinder's "attach" and "detach"
for the non-migration path to update the volumes' states.

Change-Id: I242c2c7c4a7197bbce04d0b3d75688f989ea1fd5
Closes-Bug: #1489744
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix swap_volume for case without migration

Fix swap_volume so that even when a volume-migration does not
occur, the volumes don't get stuck in "attaching" and "detaching".
Previously the swap_volume was changed in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/101932 and
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/101933 to move the final
attach and detach logic to Cinder, however those changes only fix
the migration path.  This change calls Cinder's "attach" and "detach"
for the non-migration path to update the volumes' states.

Change-Id: I242c2c7c4a7197bbce04d0b3d75688f989ea1fd5
Closes-Bug: #1489744

[{'created': '2015-11-16 03:21:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Consistency group API now returns volume type IDs

The create method of consistency group API requires a list of
volume type ids; volumes belonging to only these types can be added
to the consistency group. The get method of the consistency group API
does not, however, return the volume type id information.

Horizon needs this value for its "Add volumes to consistency group"
panel so that it can filter the "available volumes" list to only
show volumes that match the volume type associated with the consistency
group.

Change-Id: Icc3206c67227af38a7bf89ea0145942f750b506b
Closes-Bug: #1489957

commit_message:
CG API should return volume type IDs

The create method of consistency group API requires a list of
volume type ids; volumes belonging to only these types can be added
to the consistency group. The get method of the consistency group API
does not, however, return the volume type id information.

Horizon needs this value for its "Add volumes to consistency group"
panel so that it can filter the "available volumes" list to only
show volumes that match the volume type associated with the consistency
group.

This was fixed by propagating the volume type id information in
the api layer (this information is stored in the db, it just wasn't
being propagated).

APIImpact
The get method of the consistency group API now returns the volume
type ids information.

DocImpact
The screenshots in the admin guide (see
http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/blockstorage-consistency-groups.html)
should be updated to show this new field.

Change-Id: Icc3206c67227af38a7bf89ea0145942f750b506b
Closes-Bug: #1489957

Fix T110 violations for image_client

image_client contained T110 violations, and we need to fix them
before migrating the client to tempest-lib for consistent interfaces.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

commit_message:
Added an autoscaling heat template

The template scales the workers both up and down,
dependent on the load across all of the workers. The
orchestration text has been modified to describe
how it all hangs together.

Change-Id: I5959a734ecb21476ab6359cacf49317d370cd0a5

commit_message:
Add summaries for guides on docs.openstack.org

Adds a summary line for each guide on docs.openstack.org
in order to help users find the appropriate book for
their needs.

Adds ".docs-link-sections p" to combined.css to style
the summary lines.

Changes applied to Juno, Kilo, Liberty, and Mitaka.

Change-Id: Ibcbc3d18981a58184646f55b93e77032e4f6c1c0

subject: Include params in multipart message part content-type
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-25 19:06:08.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/swob.py', 'test/unit/common/test_swob.py'], 'message': 'Include params in multipart message part content-type

The content-type header inserted into a multipart message part
is missing any params such as charset because its value is being
fetched via the swob.Response content_type property, which conforms
to webob spec and strips off all params.

This was noticed in work on feature/crypto branch because the crypto
meta param was being stripped off content-type in multipart messages,
preventing the content-type being decrypted. But in general there is
no suggestion in the multipart message spec [1] that params should
not be included. In fact examples in [1] show the charset param
included in the content-type value.

To ensure that the multipart message part content-type includes the
original content-type params, fetch it directly from the response
headers.

[1] http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc1341/7_2_Multipart.html

Change-Id: Iff7274aa631a92cd7332212ed8b4378c27da4a1f
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Include params in multipart message part content-type

The content-type header inserted into a multipart message part
is missing any params such as charset because its value is being
fetched via the swob.Response content_type property, which conforms
to webob spec and strips off all params.

This was noticed in work on feature/crypto branch because the crypto
meta param was being stripped off content-type in multipart messages,
preventing the content-type being decrypted. But in general there is
no suggestion in the multipart message spec [1] that params should
not be included. In fact examples in [1] show the charset param
included in the content-type value.

To ensure that the multipart message part content-type includes the
original content-type params, fetch it directly from the response
headers.

[1] http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc1341/7_2_Multipart.html

Change-Id: Iff7274aa631a92cd7332212ed8b4378c27da4a1f

commit_message:
Use Tempest-lib's compute security_group_default_rule

Compute security_group_default_rule has been migrated to
tempest-lib- I8b652aeb82d2a7335212ef7cc021a969ad297c6a

Now Tempest-lib provides this client as stable interface so Tempest
should start using this from lib and remove its own copy.
Also remove its unit tests.

This commit makes Tempest to use compute security_group_default_rule
from Tempest-lib.

Change-Id: I6be919a2845a08426758d19890919e6d97d2161d

commit_message:
Add project_id to extension URL

os-extensions need project_id in order to find resource.
The doc need to tell user it's needed.

Also, add os-server-external-events as sample to resource
alias instead of name like ServerExternalEvents.

(df) removed unused samples
(df) moved samples to extension-info folder

Change-Id: Ia46fed559e94a55c20281e5ebc1d4ef08118566c
Partial-Bug: 1515222

description. Corrects the description of policy.

commit_message:
return all endpoints if service type is empty

Currently we only return endpoints related to a specific service
type from service catalog, this patch enables return all endpoints
if service type is empty.

Change-Id: I8f61941664f6dea9521346dac53cc47bd1e09542
Related-Bug: #1451336

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-08 12:58:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[WIP] Split conductor manager into several files

Change-Id: I2de8f45a813f1a54f97d1ef763288c81cb37e9e8
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-10-08 14:41:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Split conductor manager into several files

* manager.py now contains everything concerning starting/stopping
  the service and managing threads. Periodic tasks are also left
  there for simplicity (at least for now).
* provision_api.py contains implementations of everything around
  provision: deploying, tearing down, cleaning, except for inspection.
* misc_api.py contains implementations of the remaning API's.

Unit tests were separated accordingly.

This is required to make hacking on blueprint futurist a bit easier :)

Change-Id: I2de8f45a813f1a54f97d1ef763288c81cb37e9e8
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-10-08 14:59:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Split conductor manager into several files

* manager.py now contains everything concerning starting/stopping
  the service and managing threads. Periodic tasks are also left
  there for simplicity (at least for now).
* provision_api.py contains implementations of everything around
  provision: deploying, tearing down, cleaning, except for inspection.
* misc_api.py contains implementations of the remaning API's.
* utils.py now contains error handlers, set_node_cleaning_steps was
  moved here as well as it is used from outside of the conductor manager
  (namely, from agent base vendor).

Unit tests were separated accordingly.

This is required to make hacking on blueprint futurist a bit easier :)

Change-Id: I2de8f45a813f1a54f97d1ef763288c81cb37e9e8
", 'number': 3}, {'created': '2015-10-12 08:12:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Split conductor manager into several files

* manager.py now contains everything concerning starting/stopping
  the service and managing threads. Periodic tasks are also left
  there for simplicity (at least for now).
* provision_api.py contains implementations of everything around
  provision: deploying, tearing down, cleaning, except for inspection.
* misc_api.py contains implementations of the remaning API's.
* utils.py now contains error handlers, set_node_cleaning_steps was
  moved here as well as it is used from outside of the conductor manager
  (namely, from agent base vendor).

Unit tests were separated accordingly.

This is required to make hacking on blueprint futurist a bit easier :)

Change-Id: I2de8f45a813f1a54f97d1ef763288c81cb37e9e8
", 'number': 4}, {'created': '2015-10-16 14:46:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Move common code from ironic.conductor.manager to ironic.conductor.utils

This is the first patch in a chain of refactoring patches in preparation
for moving to Futurist library. See blueprint futurist for details.

Moving *_error_handler from manager.py to utils.py as they're used
in many places, including outside of conductor. Also moving
set_node_cleaning_step. This should simplify defining public API
for 3rdparty drivers later on.

Change-Id: I2de8f45a813f1a54f97d1ef763288c81cb37e9e8

commit_message:
Move common code from ironic.conductor.manager to ironic.conductor.utils

This is the first patch in a chain of refactoring patches in preparation
for moving to Futurist library. See blueprint futurist for details.

Moving *_error_handler from manager.py to utils.py as they're used
in many places, including outside of conductor. Also moving
set_node_cleaning_step. This should simplify defining public API
for 3rdparty drivers later on.

Change-Id: I2de8f45a813f1a54f97d1ef763288c81cb37e9e8

commit_message:
Use Tempest-lib's compute quotas_client

Compute quotas_client has been migrated to
tempest-lib- Ib0fcb82ce09ea68d9899836264e8037ac977347b

Now Tempest-lib provides this client as stable interface so Tempest
should start using this from lib and remove its own copy.
Also remove its unit tests.

This commit makes Tempest to use compute quotas_client
from Tempest-lib.

Change-Id: Idbe0014ee44a74af02753848d244b8360bb5f9fc

subject: Removes discover from test-reqs
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-24 20:52:28.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Removes discover from test-reqs

The discover package is part of Python 2.7, so we don't need
to explicitely require it. It's by the way annoying for
distribution package maintainers, as the file has to be
patched.

Keystone team has decided to drop python 2.6 support[1],
so, it's safe to remove it from test-requirements.txt.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/keystone/2015/keystone.2015-11-24-17.59.html

Change-Id: I31acab336691d2d49275dd7ae654c8b7e9b76fcc
Co-Authored-By: Thomas Goirand <thomas@goirand.fr>
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Removes discover from test-reqs

The discover package is part of Python 2.7, so we don't need
to explicitely require it. It's by the way annoying for
distribution package maintainers, as the file has to be
patched.

Keystone team has decided to drop python 2.6 support[1],
so, it's safe to remove it from test-requirements.txt.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/keystone/2015/keystone.2015-11-24-17.59.html

Change-Id: I31acab336691d2d49275dd7ae654c8b7e9b76fcc
Co-Authored-By: Thomas Goirand <thomas@goirand.fr>

commit_message:
Don't reraise the exception in _set_console_mode

As _set_console_mode runs in a thread worker in the backgroud,
there's no way to catch the reraise exception, so change to log
an error message to handle this more gracefully.

Closes-Bug: #1513858
Change-Id: I0df54e6600a47b627d1442e92f80f0ff8654e616

Running keystoneclient unittest is really painful, because it's
impossible to see what failed in all of the deprecation output.

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5803, 'name': 'Attila Fazekas', 'email': 'afazekas@redhat.com', 'username': 'afazekas'}, {'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}, {'_account_id': 6854, 'name': 'YAMAMOTO Takashi', 'email': 'yamamoto@midokura.com', 'username': 'yamamoto'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 13777, 'name': 'Nicolas Trangez', 'email': 'ikke@nicolast.be', 'username': 'nicolast'}, {'_account_id': 16208, 'name': 'Emmanuel Cazenave', 'email': 'contact@emcaz.fr', 'username': 'cazino'}, {'_account_id': 16986, 'name': 'Shuquan Huang', 'email': 'huang.shuquan@99cloud.net', 'username': 'shuquan'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-22 15:31:20.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/thirdparty/boto/test_ec2_instance_run.py', 'tempest/api/network/test_dhcp_ipv6.py'], 'message': 'Bring back Python 2.6 compat (don"t use dict comprehension)

We have a couple of places where we use dict comprehension. Dict
comprehension are just syntaxic sugar and can be replaced with
dict((k,v) for k,v in iterable) for Python 2.6 compat

I know Tempest doesn"t support Python 2.6 anymore and I agree it's
the good decision. But I am not a fan of "dropping support for the
sake of it", without compeling reason (like using a new module).

I am in charge of a 3rd party CI and my employer wants to have
Centos 6 support for OpenStack Juno. We use Tempest as our non-reg
test suite. Tempest is branchless.

This patch brings back Python 2.6 compatibility.

Change-Id: I23aeafcc9e68d09342a773d2e202f01884080fa3
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Bring back Python 2.6 compat (don"t use dict comprehension)

We have a couple of places where we use dict comprehension. Dict
comprehension are just syntaxic sugar and can be replaced with
dict((k,v) for k,v in iterable) for Python 2.6 compat

I know Tempest doesn"t support Python 2.6 anymore and I agree it's
the good decision. But I am not a fan of "dropping support for the
sake of it", without compeling reason (like using a new module).

I am in charge of a 3rd party CI and my employer wants to have
Centos 6 support for OpenStack Juno. We use Tempest as our non-reg
test suite. Tempest is branchless.

This patch brings back Python 2.6 compatibility.

Change-Id: I23aeafcc9e68d09342a773d2e202f01884080fa3

commit_message:
Catch InvalidImageStatusTransition error

Now, when delete image to unallowed status, it will raise a 500
error. So we should catch that error to avoid it.

Change-Id: I47f777a81a6069793dfa4d52eace79edb266669d
Closes-bug: #1505474

commit_message:
Ensure ephemeral user's user_id is url-safe

As a principle, an attribute ``user_id`` should always be url safe and
we should make sure this is the case especially for the federated
authentication workflow as user name and id can be provided directly
from the user (either hardcoded in the mapping rule or passed as a
parameter from the assertion).

Change-Id: I7256a5e4d31d3c2e55fe956fb0170452bb241078
Closes-Bug: #1487115
(cherry picked from commit 02f8576ddf2fca67849171aa7a1b41ebcfa90ded)

commit_message:
Show that unscoped tokens are revoked when deleting role assignments

Unscoped tokens should, in fact, NOT be revoked when deleting role
assignments, but this test demonstrates the opposite behavior to be the
case.

Change-Id: Ie4c844b4c2c8dae5d9f6b01404fd153b8155870d
Partial-Bug: 1488208
(cherry picked from commit 5ced3c77430d9a0bd871d5387c9aadb9df1c0060)

commit_message:
Check shellinabox started successfully or not

Shellinabox daemon always return 0 and leave pid file even if it
started failed, so this patch checks whether the process is running.

Change-Id: I1ac32d4b0d0248bdffdce7a7cf88102f58f1c0da
Closes-Bug: #1516897

commit_message:
Set start/stop pacemaker resource timeouts for updates

This matches change I6fc18f1ad876c5a25723710a3b20d8ec9519dcba, but we
need it to set it before attempting the cluster stop - yum update -
cluster start cycle, to make sure this cycle doesn't hit the low timeout
limits.

This can be removed once updates from deployments made prior to
I6fc18f1ad876c5a25723710a3b20d8ec9519dcba are no longer supported.

Change-Id: I587136d8d045d213875c657ea5a405074f80c8ad
(cherry picked from commit 5c2d5e335b84485808094173e006e520ccd522db)

subject: Add missing constraints in yum_update.sh
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-16 10:28:58.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/yum_update.sh'], 'message': "Add missing constraints in yum_update.sh

Some missing pacemaker constraints were added in the following commits:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/219770/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/219665/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/218931/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/218930/

Overclouds that were deployed prior to these constraints being added to
tripleo-heat-templates still have the constraints missing. During an
update, stopping and starting the cluster can fail without these
constraints in place.  As a workaround, conditionally add these
contraints in yum_update.sh so that we're sure they're always present
before updating.

Change-Id: Id46c85dbbe5e85d362279661091b17ce1b697fe0
(cherry picked from commit bfb698e82becf7f53c670618365311029b4f73b8)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add missing constraints in yum_update.sh

Some missing pacemaker constraints were added in the following commits:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/219770/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/219665/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/218931/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/218930/

Overclouds that were deployed prior to these constraints being added to
tripleo-heat-templates still have the constraints missing. During an
update, stopping and starting the cluster can fail without these
constraints in place.  As a workaround, conditionally add these
contraints in yum_update.sh so that we're sure they're always present
before updating.

Change-Id: Id46c85dbbe5e85d362279661091b17ce1b697fe0
(cherry picked from commit bfb698e82becf7f53c670618365311029b4f73b8)

commit_message:
Refactor IRMCVirtualMediaAgentDeploy by applying new BootInterface

This patch refactors IRMCVirtualMediaAgentDeploy by applying new
BootInterface. Consequently IRMCVirtualMediaAgentDeploy is divided
into IRMCVirtualMediaBoot and IRMCVirtualMediaAgentDeploy.

Implements: blueprint irmc-driver-uses-boot-interface

Change-Id: I7cae6588dfeffec3c5667ecabdb164ca72d63f22

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-08 09:45:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Removes discover from test-reqs

The discover package is part of Python 2.7, so we don't need
to explicitely require it. It's by the way annoying for
distribution package maintainers, as the file has to be
patched.

Co-Authored-By: Thomas Goirand <thomas@goirand.fr>
Change-Id: I5bb258a4b305c0084be50bc22fe7a0e6a4f65aad
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-24 21:02:06.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Removes discover from test-reqs

The discover package is part of Python 2.7, so we don't need
to explicitely require it. It's by the way annoying for
distribution package maintainers, as the file has to be
patched.

Keystone team has decided to drop python 2.6 support[1],
so, it's safe to remove it from test-requirements.txt.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/keystone/2015/keystone.2015-11-24-17.59.html

Related-Bug: #1519449
Co-Authored-By: Thomas Goirand <thomas@goirand.fr>

commit_message:
Removes discover from test-reqs

The discover package is part of Python 2.7, so we don't need
to explicitely require it. It's by the way annoying for
distribution package maintainers, as the file has to be
patched.

Keystone team has decided to drop python 2.6 support[1],
so, it's safe to remove it from test-requirements.txt.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/keystone/2015/keystone.2015-11-24-17.59.html

Related-Bug: #1519449
Co-Authored-By: Thomas Goirand <thomas@goirand.fr>
Change-Id: I5bb258a4b305c0084be50bc22fe7a0e6a4f65aad

commit_message:
Add "httpchk /versions" for glance-api haproxy.

With the default httpchk, glance-api always show warning in the logs
"WARNING glance.api.middleware.version_negotiation [..] Unknown version.
Returning version choices", with the /versions added, there is no
warning in the log.

Change-Id: I086cb23c30b9e3ddc5eac68cba42d03ed907138c
(cherry picked from commit 2a2da2f5aa271eebb06016060c62eee4618a0228)

commit_message:
Remove useless ResourceManager.register_model()

All the d6cage API service objects are contained in
ElementHandler and CollectionHandler, so that isn't
necessary to register model, remove the related logic
and method.

Change-Id: I7cb0bf05085864c77c731869946bcee551228ae1

subject: Remove execute table from policy table list
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-31 03:20:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Remove execute table from policy table list

Now when we create a reactive policy, like:
'execute[nova:servers.pause(x)] :- nova:servers(id=x, status="ACTIVE")',
the tables 'nova:servers.pause' and 'nova:servers' will present in the
output of 'congress policy table list', the user might want to list table
rows by the table 'nova:servers.pause', that shouldn't be supported by
Congress, 'nova:servers.pause' is just a service API or user-defined
function, not a regular table, so filter this type table out from
policy.tablenames(), avoid this operation.

Change-Id: I9846d67dbbb8f808ee5a78d0c3317fd04ac68896
Related-Bug: #1454844

commit_message:
Remove execute table from policy table list

Now when we create a reactive policy, like:
'execute[nova:servers.pause(x)] :- nova:servers(id=x, status="ACTIVE")',
the tables 'nova:servers.pause' and 'nova:servers' will present in the
output of 'congress policy table list', the user might want to list table
rows by the table 'nova:servers.pause', that shouldn't be supported by
Congress, 'nova:servers.pause' is just a service API or user-defined
function, not a regular table, so filter this type table out from
policy.tablenames(), avoid this operation.

Change-Id: I9846d67dbbb8f808ee5a78d0c3317fd04ac68896
Closes-Bug: #1454844

commit_message:
initialize ceilometerclient when we use it

There is a chance that ceilometerclient cannot be initialized if
keystone is not available, putting the initialization in __init__
will fail to load threshold extension for such case.

This patch moves the initialization out from __init__ to a dedicate
property method.

Change-Id: I24895126c3efe9920390401e4d10a2ce6b1f1376
Closes-Bug: #1518447

1) Editing the playbooks (and hope to not forget to write the sudo/become lines for every role)

I'm taking the second approach with the minimum set of variables (become_method is sudo by default and become_user is root by default).

commit_message:
Use sudo for role testing

There are 2 ways to realize the privilege escalation
needed for the gate jobs.

1) Editing the playbooks (and hope to not forget to
write the sudo/become lines for every role)
2) Editing the inventory and set the variable there.

I'm taking the second approach with the minimum set
of variables (become_method is sudo by default and
become_user is root by default).

Change-Id: Iac16f49b514f41684b319e3d091b52513f721b55
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Pin setuptools == 18.5

Yesterday the new versions of setuptools (18.6 and 18.6.1) were released
where some functionality such as installation in the editable mode was
broken. It will be fixed in the 18.6.2 release.

Change-Id: Id19879c788efbba6c6e72fe6a4a97418df124525
Partial-Bug: #1519727

commit_message:
Add synchronizer for policies and rules

This synchronizer keeps the policy engine's policies and rules in sync with
the database.  With this change, Congress should be able to run policy engine
replicas side-by-side in an high-availability configuration.

Implements blueprint: basic-high-availability
Change-Id: I72d8a9952d8345129656c4a701896614fa837a08

commit_message:
Modularize inventory and add initial testing

The inventory module for bifrost is a vital component, however
as it was developed as a single file and it needs to to be broken
up into a modular chunk in order to have meaningful testing.

Broke into module, symlinking the file into place for now until
documentation and install process can be updated.

Added two basic tests to lay the groundwork for basic testing
of the data parsing and result passing.

Change-Id: I02e79b635202a7933ae641b9d27cc19a75b7bc4f
Partial-Bug: 1499801

[{'created': '2015-11-17 12:22:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add switch to enable/disable streaming raw images for IPA

This patch is adding a configuration option called "stream_raw_images"
under the "agent" group. By default this option is set to True, meaning
that the IPA ramdisk will be instructed to stream raw images directly
onto the disk instead of copying it to a tmpfs partition prior of
writing it to the disk. By streaming raw images IPA will consume less
memory to run and the deployment will be faster (unless the disk being
deployed is really slow).

Depends-On: Iddf67907bc9b54bbd3065a97064cb5a3602cfe18
Related-Bug: #1505685

commit_message:
Add switch to enable/disable streaming raw images for IPA

This patch is adding a configuration option called "stream_raw_images"
under the "agent" group. By default this option is set to True, meaning
that the IPA ramdisk will be instructed to stream raw images directly
onto the disk instead of copying it to a tmpfs partition prior of
writing it to the disk. By streaming raw images IPA will consume less
memory to run and the deployment will be faster (unless the disk being
deployed is really slow).

Depends-On: Iddf67907bc9b54bbd3065a97064cb5a3602cfe18
Related-Bug: #1505685
Change-Id: I7e7ed7e7aeebbf7c936605a72aa974db2123a43e

commit_message:
Bug  :  Not able to create a resource without sync attribute

description : when user just want to check the limit of quota,
without sync attribute,function gives error.

DocImpact
closes-Bug:1455346

[{'created': '2015-11-18 11:09:22.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/ibm/gpfs.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_gpfs.py'], 'message': "Fix metadata retrieval in GPFS driver

GPFS driver was using 'volume_metadata' to get the
volume metadata. With versionedobjects, it is to be
retrieved using 'metadata' from volume.
This patch fixes the issue. It first tries for 'volume_metadata'
in the volume object, if not present, it will try for 'metadata'
to get the metadata.

Change-Id: I97649874ab54187a469193c8cae773409e9913e6
Closes-bug: 1517404
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix metadata retrieval in GPFS driver

GPFS driver was using 'volume_metadata' to get the
volume metadata. With versionedobjects, it is to be
retrieved using 'metadata' from volume.
This patch fixes the issue. It first tries for 'volume_metadata'
in the volume object, if not present, it will try for 'metadata'
to get the metadata.

Change-Id: I97649874ab54187a469193c8cae773409e9913e6
Closes-bug: 1517404

subject: Remove dependency on instance_info for DHCP config
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5805, 'name': 'Chris Krelle', 'email': 'nobodycam@gmail.com', 'username': 'nobodycam'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'On the moon! With a jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 12459, 'name': 'Stephanie Miller', 'email': 'stephane@alum.mit.edu', 'username': 'cinerama'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-13 19:29:45.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/bifrost-deploy-nodes-dynamic/tasks/main.yml'], 'message': 'Remove dependency on instance_info for DHCP config

According to the documentation[1], instance_info variable is used to
define the instance that will be deployed, and has nothing to do with
its networking configuration. It therefore is not sensible to only
allow static DHCP settings for nodes with instance_info defined since
"By default, this is NOT expected to be defined".

Moreover, when the new dhcp-hosts file is created in
bifrost.dhcp-hosts.d/, dnsmasq needs to re-read this directory
regardless of whether instance_info is defined, so it does not make
sense for the "Sending dnsmasq HUP" task to be dependent on
instance_info NOT being defined.

Sending HUP should be safe to do; according to the dnsmasq man page,

  When it receives a SIGHUP, dnsmasq clears its cache and then
  re-loads /etc/hosts and /etc/ethers and any file given by
  --dhcp-hostsfile, --dhcp-hostsdir, --dhcp-optsfile, --dhcp-optsdir,
  --addn-hosts or --hostsdir. The dhcp lease change script is called
  for all existing DHCP leases. If --no-poll is set SIGHUP also
  re-reads /etc/resolv.conf. SIGHUP does NOT re-read the configuration
  file."

This does not imply any disruption of service. This assumption is
consistent with a reading of the dnsmasq signal handling code[2].

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/bifrost/tree/playbooks/roles/bifrost-deploy-nodes-dynamic/README.md#n45
[2] http://bazaar.launchpad.net/~vcs-imports/dnsmasq/master/view/head:/src/dnsmasq.c#L1193

Change-Id: Iae0dae8ad4dd7c9f2263b97875702ed0970761cf
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove dependency on instance_info for DHCP config

According to the documentation[1], instance_info variable is used to
define the instance that will be deployed, and has nothing to do with
its networking configuration. It therefore is not sensible to only
allow static DHCP settings for nodes with instance_info defined since
"By default, this is NOT expected to be defined".

Moreover, when the new dhcp-hosts file is created in
bifrost.dhcp-hosts.d/, dnsmasq needs to re-read this directory
regardless of whether instance_info is defined, so it does not make
sense for the "Sending dnsmasq HUP" task to be dependent on
instance_info NOT being defined.

Sending HUP should be safe to do; according to the dnsmasq man page,

  When it receives a SIGHUP, dnsmasq clears its cache and then
  re-loads /etc/hosts and /etc/ethers and any file given by
  --dhcp-hostsfile, --dhcp-hostsdir, --dhcp-optsfile, --dhcp-optsdir,
  --addn-hosts or --hostsdir. The dhcp lease change script is called
  for all existing DHCP leases. If --no-poll is set SIGHUP also
  re-reads /etc/resolv.conf. SIGHUP does NOT re-read the configuration
  file."

This does not imply any disruption of service. This assumption is
consistent with a reading of the dnsmasq signal handling code[2].

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/bifrost/tree/playbooks/roles/bifrost-deploy-nodes-dynamic/README.md#n45
[2] http://bazaar.launchpad.net/~vcs-imports/dnsmasq/master/view/head:/src/dnsmasq.c#L1193

Change-Id: Iae0dae8ad4dd7c9f2263b97875702ed0970761cf

Add python3 testing to neutron-lib

It's a new library, so I don't see any reason we can't keep it
python3 clean from the beginning.

Change-Id: I4475e613ecd7e246ac0a42077fb07ca6eb217de9

subject: Make delete_server() return True/False
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-25 16:33:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Make delete_server() return True/False

To be consistent with our other delete API methods, make delete_server()
return True if the delete succeeded, or False if the server was not
deleted because it was not found.

This also combines the functional testing of create_server() and
delete_server() so that tests are more efficient by eliminating an
extra instance creation. This is in anticipation of adding more
tests that will create server instances and there are only so
many resources available in the test environment.

Change-Id: If1b1a3886df60fb064682caa23113f91b78a4090

commit_message:
Make delete_server() return True/False

To be consistent with our other delete API methods, make delete_server()
return True if the delete succeeded, or False if the server was not
deleted because it was not found.

This also combines the functional testing of create_server() and
delete_server() so that tests are more efficient by eliminating an
extra instance creation. This is in anticipation of adding more
tests that will create server instances and there are only so
many resources available in the test environment.

Change-Id: If1b1a3886df60fb064682caa23113f91b78a4090

commit_message:
VMware: Skip unsupported datastore types

vCenter supports different types of datastores such as
VMFS, NFS etc. Currently the VMDK driver supports only
vSAN, VMFS and NFS datastores for storing volume vmdks.
This patch adds a check to skip unsupported datastore
types during volume creation.

Closes-bug: #1519316
Change-Id: I314abbe0de09bb304859c72b27054784eeef9044

commit_message:
Add 'hw:cpu_threads_policy=separate' scheduling

The 'separate' CPU threads policy requires a host with an SMT
architecture but ensures vCPUs are allocated from non-thread siblings.
This is useful for workloads that may see performance impacts due to
contention.

Change-Id: I18b3a6413450d5f0cbc3eb8e66a2bcda23293478
Implements: blueprint virt-driver-cpu-thread-pinning

subject: Fix more unhandled errors for full validation
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-19 19:13:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix more unhandled errors for full validation

Fix some errors that are not being handled for full validation.
They include some invalid node template and outputs property names,

commit_message:
Fix more unhandled errors for full validation

Fix some errors that are not being handled for full validation.
They include some invalid node template and outputs property names,
and references to non-existing node templates. Also, add proper
unit tests.

Change-Id: Idba3382f3c8e1fcf6671a166f21ad003fdfbcc6b
Closes-Bug: #1517728

commit_message:
Use sudo for role testing

There are 2 ways to realize the privilege escalation
needed for the gate jobs.

1) Editing the playbooks (and hope to not forget to
write the sudo/become lines for every role)
2) Editing the inventory and set the variable there.

I'm taking the second approach with the minimum set
of variables (become_method is sudo by default and
become_user is root by default).

Change-Id: I066ac778f7bf3d3f569791e30067bcab4e8eef6b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-19 08:46:13.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/neutronv2/api.py', 'nova/network/model.py'], 'message': 'SR-IOV: Improve the vnic type check in the neutron api

The check is "if the vnic_type is not NORMAL" which is fine

commit_message:
SR-IOV: Improve the vnic type check in the neutron api

The Neutronv2 API checks the vnic_type to see whether
or not it should include a PCI requests for SR-IOV ports.
The check is "if the vnic_type is not NORMAL" which is fine
for now that we have only NORMAL, DIRECT and MACVTAP, but in the future more vnic types
can be added. This patch update the check to be what the vnic types
are expecting to be.

Change-Id: I7b8ba1acfbafc3d02ab50afadf4627fcce052484

commit_message:
Adjust conditions when enable_snat is specified

Some clouds barf about policy if the enable_snat attribute is
sent during router creation. Only send it if it is different
from the default (i.e., only when False).

This is a fix for:
https://github.com/ansible/ansible-modules-core/issues/2474

Change-Id: Id656029b9cf593fcb8e0771fa19c567126c565ee

Actually, all uses of export_location are incorrect -- from the
layout code's point of view of, export_location is an arbitrary
opaque value, obtained from self.driver._setip_via_manager with
which the only legit action is to return it from create_share*.

That we use export_location as dict key in ensure_share is just
a pre-layout relict that survived by the virtue of remaining

opaque value, obtained from self.driver._setup_via_manager with
which the only legit action is to return it from create_share*.

That we use export_location as dict key in ensure_share is just
a pre-layout relict that survived by the virtue of remaining

commit_message:
glusterfs/volume layout: fix incorrect usage of export_location

Actually, all uses of export_location are incorrect -- from the
layout code's point of view, export_location is an arbitrary
opaque value, obtained from self.driver._setup_via_manager with
which the only legit action is to return it from create_share*.

That we use export_location as dict key in ensure_share is just
a pre-layout relict that survived by the virtue of remaining
unnoticed. Now the referred bug forced it out of the dark.

Change-Id: I965dae99486002f00145daff0cd2a848777b5b81
Partial-Bug: #1501670

commit_message:
Fix gate-nova-functional-constraints

Tox runs gerrit-git-prep, however when constraints are used
zuul-git-prep-upper-constraints must be used.  Make a new tox job
template that pulls in the required git-prep and update nova to use it.

Implements Blueprint: Requirements-Management

Change-Id: I59fcf763d7eb9252e950dce5783befc20b4e8fd4

commit_message:
Declare multiattach is True in LVMVolume driver

An LVM volume can be attached to multi instances, however,
this feature is not declared in LVMVolume driver. As a result,
if a user create a multi-attached volume using LVMVolume as
backend, they will be failed.

In this commit, we declared multiattach is True in LVMVolume
driver.

Change-Id: I66a4d62054fee14da6cf029084074453b30eb1bc

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-08 21:48:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Port IBM storewize_svc driver to Python 3

Change default preferred node in
StorwizeSVCDriver.initialize_connection(). For fiber channel without
multipath, sort the list of nodes and pick the first node, to have a
determinist preferred node. The list of nodes is created indirectly
using list(set(nodes)) which doesn't have a determinist order. On
Python 3, the hash function is randomized, and so list(set()) has an
unknown order.

A similar change was done for volume throttling in the change
Icf7141f772397c7ac08f0f1e21ad74cb86a06351 to port the code
to Python 3.

Other changes:

* Use list(set()) in test_storwize_svc to get the expected order on
  Python 3 (the hash function is randomized on Python 3).
* StorwizeSVCDriver._check_volume_copy_ops(): replace dict.items()
  with list(dict.items()) to iterate on items. On Python 3,
  dict.items() now returns a view instead of a copy. The loop
  modifies the dictionary and a dict must not be modified while
  iterating on it, we really need a copy of items.
* StorwizeHelpers: replace a/b with a//b to use integer division on
  Python 3.
* tests-py3.txt: add cinder.tests.unit.test_storwize_svc

Change-Id: I534a85928816d6cce921545e1820311aedd1b884
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-08 22:58:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Port IBM storewize_svc driver to Python 3

Change default preferred node in
StorwizeSVCDriver.initialize_connection(). For fiber channel without
multipath, sort the list of nodes and pick the first node, to have a
determinist preferred node. The list of nodes is created indirectly
using list(set(nodes)) which doesn't have a determinist order. On
Python 3, the hash function is randomized, and so list(set()) has an
unknown order.

A similar change was done for volume throttling in the change
Icf7141f772397c7ac08f0f1e21ad74cb86a06351 to port the code
to Python 3.

Other changes:

* Use list(set()) in test_storwize_svc to get the expected order on
  Python 3 (the hash function is randomized on Python 3).
* StorwizeSVCDriver._check_volume_copy_ops(): replace dict.items()
  with list(dict.items()) to iterate on items. On Python 3,
  dict.items() now returns a view instead of a copy. The loop
  modifies the dictionary and a dict must not be modified while
  iterating on it, we really need a copy of items.
* StorwizeHelpers: replace a/b with a//b to use integer division on
  Python 3.
* tests-py3.txt: add cinder.tests.unit.test_storwize_svc

Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: I534a85928816d6cce921545e1820311aedd1b884
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-11-09 11:10:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Port IBM storewize_svc driver to Python 3

Change default preferred node in
StorwizeSVCDriver.initialize_connection(). For fiber channel without
multipath, pick the first node from the list of sorted nodes, to have
a determinist preferred node. The list of nodes is created indirectly
using list(set(nodes)) which doesn't have a determinist order. On
Python 3, the hash function is randomized, and so list(set()) has an
unknown order.

A similar change was done for volume throttling in the change
Icf7141f772397c7ac08f0f1e21ad74cb86a06351 to port the code
to Python 3.

Other changes:

* Use assertSetEqual() in test_storwize_svc to compare
  initiator_target_map, because conn_wwpns has a random order on
  Python 3.
* StorwizeSVCDriver._check_volume_copy_ops(): replace dict.items()
  with list(dict.items()) to iterate on items. On Python 3,
  dict.items() now returns a view instead of a copy. The loop
  modifies the dictionary and a dict must not be modified while
  iterating on it, we really need a copy of items.
* StorwizeHelpers: replace a/b with a//b to use integer division on
  Python 3.
* tests-py3.txt: add cinder.tests.unit.test_storwize_svc

commit_message:
Port IBM storewize_svc driver to Python 3

Change default preferred node in
StorwizeSVCDriver.initialize_connection(). For fiber channel without
multipath, pick the first node from the list of sorted nodes, to have
a determinist preferred node. The list of nodes is created indirectly
using list(set(nodes)) which doesn't have a determinist order. On
Python 3, the hash function is randomized, and so list(set()) has an
unknown order.

A similar change was done for volume throttling in the change
Icf7141f772397c7ac08f0f1e21ad74cb86a06351 to port the code
to Python 3.

Other changes:

* Use assertSetEqual() in test_storwize_svc to compare
  initiator_target_map, because conn_wwpns has a random order on
  Python 3.
* StorwizeSVCDriver._check_volume_copy_ops(): replace dict.items()
  with list(dict.items()) to iterate on items. On Python 3,
  dict.items() now returns a view instead of a copy. The loop
  modifies the dictionary and a dict must not be modified while
  iterating on it, we really need a copy of items.
* StorwizeHelpers: replace a/b with a//b to use integer division on
  Python 3.
* tests-py3.txt: add cinder.tests.unit.test_storwize_svc

Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: I534a85928816d6cce921545e1820311aedd1b884

commit_message:
Use oslo_config new type PortOpt for port options

The oslo_config library provides new type PortOpt to validate the
range of port now.

Note, rpc_zmq_max_port is a socket port upper limit, so leave it untouched.

Change-Id: Icac28141bcb09e2b894662de1a6497766351919d
Closes-Bug: #1518256
ref: https://github.com/openstack/oslo.config/blob/2.6.0/oslo_config/cfg.py#L1114

commit_message:
Make zuul-git-prep-upper-constraints safe for post

Extend zuul-git-prep-upper-constraints to infer a target branch from
$ZUUL_REFNAME when $ZUUL_BRANCH is not present. This works around
the absence of branch guidance for ref-updated triggers in post
pipeline jobs, where Zuul is not told a branch but Gerrit instead
uses the branch as the refname for the event.

Change-Id: I3fd06cc1f09847f6731f80deb00fd1515f0106e9

commit_message:
Add 'hw:cpu_threads_policy=avoid' filtering

The 'avoid' CPU threads policy prevents guests from being scheduled
onto hosts utilising SMT technologies, such as Intel Hyper-Threading
Technology. SMT provides performance benefits, but comes at the cost
of reduced determinism. This makes it unsuitable for some workloads
were such determinism is critical, e.g. NFV.

Add support for this 'avoid' CPU threads policy filter. This is
achieved through the use of the NUMA topology filter.

Change-Id: I7fc87755e1035bd5dd31bfd334213e41829bea2d
Implements: blueprint virt-driver-cpu-thread-pinning

commit_message:
Remove AuxAddresses from the required properties

This patch removes AuxAddresses in IPv4Data and IPv6Data in the request
against /NetworkDriver.CreateNetwork. It can not be given if it's not
specified by the CLI rather than it's set to an empty JSON object.

Change-Id: I5a36fa78adee09d91c19d533bfcf660109a0ec21
Signed-off-by: Taku Fukushima <f.tac.mac@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1519260

commit_message:
Add Warning when we cannot notify

Calling Notifier.audit() won't work with LogDriver as the
logger does not have a audit level anymore, So let's at
least not fail silently and let the operators know that
we are dropping stuff on the floor.

Closes-Bug: #1518170
Change-Id: I74002c72e6763ea8b5df7d97d722619bd4a1950b

subject: Default for root_helper config
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-25 16:02:49.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_lib/utils.py', 'ironic_lib/tests/test_utils.py'], 'message': "Default for root_helper config

This sets the default for root_helper config to the value used
by ironic: 'sudo ironic-rootwrap /etc/ironic/rootwrap.conf'.

The logic was changed a bit so as not to pass root_helper or
run_as_root arguments to processutils.execute() unless they
had been specified or needed to be passed.

commit_message:
Default for root_helper config

This sets the default for root_helper config to the value used
by ironic: 'sudo ironic-rootwrap /etc/ironic/rootwrap.conf'.

The logic was changed a bit so as not to pass root_helper or
run_as_root arguments to processutils.execute() unless they
had been specified or needed to be passed.

Change-Id: I8cf8c07102d0a8bd4fff14afc8c2f9db6beeb949
Fixes-Bug: #1519870

commit_message:
Print the JJB template name in devstack jobs

There are a lot of devstack jobs based on a lot of very similarly
named templates.  Have the jobs print out the template name at the
start to make tracking down the actual definition easier.

Change-Id: I059735cfc7f9cd43a81650675917bdc8c3d129f5
Depends-On: I1cfed9c27a58b45ba48aeed04839bfc8f54a831e

commit_message:
Fix resource leak in test_compute

Depending on the time between the create_server() and
delete_server() calls, it's possible the delete does not
actually find the server we want to delete, so we leave
instances hanging around after our tests. Fix this by waiting
for the servers with wait=True to create_server().

Change-Id: I908fdb94dcf5e410597a7cd3ecc6c962f2bfbce3

commit_message:
Declare multiattach is True in RBD driver

An RBD volume can be attached to multi instances, however,
this feature is not declared in RBD driver. As a result,
if a user create a multi-attached volume using RBD as
backend, they will be failed.

In this commit, we declared multiattach is True in RBD
driver.

Change-Id: I70c2c0528d9c00629f9cf34d79262a5bf4750e34
Closes-Bug: #1519227

subject: Clean up compute functional tests
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-24 21:50:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Clean up compute functional tests

Although the server names being created were actually unique
across tests, this change will make the test_compute.py code
more consistent with other functional test code by creating
a server name prefix string with getUniqueString(). This also
opens the door for use across new tests.

It also changes the server cleanup code to let users know if
something went wrong with cleaning up server resources.

Also, it was discovered that the test_delete_server functional
test had a race that could cause the delete_server() method to
not actually delete the freshly created instance. So now we wait
on the new instance with wait=True.

commit_message:
Clean up compute functional tests

Although the server names being created were actually unique
across tests, this change will make the test_compute.py code
more consistent with other functional test code by creating
a server name prefix string with getUniqueString(). This also
opens the door for use across new tests.

It also changes the server cleanup code to just call
delete_server() with the name of the instance for the test.
Since tests can run in parallel, we don't want to delete an
instance with a similar name out from under some other test.

Change-Id: I1b0dc3f2759f77b7d420e45b3a7a2730868e6eb0

[{'created': '2014-10-07 19:40:35.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/util/event_simulator.py'], 'message': 'Unexpected exception on tox test output on non-error

When the co-routine invoked by the event_simulator throws an exception
it was being spit out to the stdout. This exception on a non-error is
confusing. The proposed change will enable an exception handler in the
event_simulator (which was commented out) and catch the exception and
push it to the log file.

Change-Id: I7633ded724f30836b2c5bd471d305f57ab04ce4d
Closes-Bug: #1378083
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Unexpected exception on tox test output on non-error

When the co-routine invoked by the event_simulator throws an exception
it was being spit out to the stdout. This exception on a non-error is
confusing. The proposed change will enable an exception handler in the
event_simulator (which was commented out) and catch the exception and
push it to the log file.

Change-Id: I7633ded724f30836b2c5bd471d305f57ab04ce4d
Closes-Bug: #1378083

Reasons:
- While using update-user-attributes to change the user's name or host access
  the old access to the databases remain as it is.
- There is a need to remove those old access so that any new user created with
  identical name does not get that previous existing access.

Changes:
- Added the query to delete the needful records from mysql.db for database access
- Executing the access-clearing query while update-user-attributes
  if either of user name or host is update.

commit_message:
Updates the update_user_attributes functionality

Reasons:
- While using update-user-attributes to change the user's name
  or host access the old access to the databases is left behind.
- The correct way to update user or host name is to use RENAME USER.

Changes:
- Updated statements to use "RENAME USER" for renaming the
  username or hostname.
- Updated statements to use "SET PASSWORD FOR" for changing passwords.
- Unit tests updated for sql_query.py
- Integration tests added to test the intended functionality for
  (user/host)-name updation.

Change-Id: Id87da96363d3cb932e6a92a611eebb054897a409
Closes-Bug: #1380880

[{'created': '2015-11-24 12:25:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Update: clean keepalived and radvd instances after pcs cluster stop

Older neutron versions have a bug which makes them leave keepalived and
radvd running even after all neutron services are stopped, preventing
neutron router failover from happening. Router can then get stuck on the
inactive node, like this:

[stack@instack ~]$ neutron l3-agent-list-hosting-router default_router
+--------------------------------------+------------------------------------+----------------+-------+----------+
| id                                   | host                               | admin_state_up | alive | ha_state |
+--------------------------------------+------------------------------------+----------------+-------+----------+
| 48ca9477-b93b-4305-9e6d-9f1c5d3388f0 | overcloud-controller-1.localdomain | True           | :-)   | standby  |
| eba0575c-654f-4da6-b1cd-f7fdf1cd3726 | overcloud-controller-2.localdomain | True           | :-)   | standby  |
| 68815390-251f-4425-a5f8-38bdbf3bdb90 | overcloud-controller-0.localdomain | True           | xxx   | active   |
+--------------------------------------+------------------------------------+----------------+-------+----------+

We need to kill the leftover processes manually to prevent the state
described above from happening.

Change-Id: I2deaa176222983daa0c33ab52a6aa5dbe7365302

commit_message:
Update: clean keepalived and radvd instances after pcs cluster stop

Older neutron versions have a bug which makes them leave keepalived and
radvd running even after all neutron services are stopped, preventing
neutron router failover from happening. Router can then get stuck on the
inactive node, like this:

[stack@instack ~]$ neutron l3-agent-list-hosting-router default_router
+--------------------------------------+------------------------------------+----------------+-------+----------+
| id                                   | host                               | admin_state_up | alive | ha_state |
+--------------------------------------+------------------------------------+----------------+-------+----------+
| 48ca9477-b93b-4305-9e6d-9f1c5d3388f0 | overcloud-controller-1.localdomain | True           | :-)   | standby  |
| eba0575c-654f-4da6-b1cd-f7fdf1cd3726 | overcloud-controller-2.localdomain | True           | :-)   | standby  |
| 68815390-251f-4425-a5f8-38bdbf3bdb90 | overcloud-controller-0.localdomain | True           | xxx   | active   |
+--------------------------------------+------------------------------------+----------------+-------+----------+

We need to kill the leftover processes manually to prevent the state
described above from happening.

See https://review.gerrithub.io/#/c/248931

Change-Id: I2deaa176222983daa0c33ab52a6aa5dbe7365302

subject: Corrects INCLUDE_MARKER_OPERATORS for MySQL
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-12-16 08:17:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Corrects INCLUDE_MARKER_OPERATORS for MySQL

Reasons:
- Currently the value of INCLUDE_MARKER_OPERATORS[True] means ">=".
- Because of this when matching the database name it results in
  name >= value, which results in more than needed values and
  the sorting mechanism then may return the other value similar
  to one matched as explained in bug.

Changes:
- Corrects the value for INCLUDE_MARKER_OPERATORS[True] means ">="
  to INCLUDE_MARKER_OPERATORS[True] means "=",
  so that only matched value is returned.
- Updated the tests for matching the resulting query.

Change-Id: Ia197b007917f1b5f9f681e0d2d749489235052be
Closes-Bug: #1316717

commit_message:
Corrects INCLUDE_MARKER_OPERATORS for MySQL

Reasons:
- Currently the value of INCLUDE_MARKER_OPERATORS[True] means ">=".
- Because of this when matching the database name it results in
  name >= value, which results in more than needed values and
  the sorting mechanism then may return the other value similar
  to one matched as explained in bug.

Changes:
- Corrects the value for INCLUDE_MARKER_OPERATORS[True] means ">="
  to INCLUDE_MARKER_OPERATORS[True] means "=",
  so that only matched value is returned.
- Updated the tests for matching the resulting query.

Change-Id: Ia197b007917f1b5f9f681e0d2d749489235052be
Closes-Bug: #1316717

commit_message:
Add percona int-test group

Reasons:
 - As you know, Percona is another flavor of MySQL
   community distro, and in Trove its integration
   part works with shared mysql driver.

Change-Id: I2b793506ac577953b0094a68205f56a4df765ff2
Closes-Bug: #1417518

commit_message:
User management for Vertica clusters and instances

As the spec specifies, changes were made to enable user
CRUD operations for Vertica clusters and instances.n the trove
client. Depending on whether its an instance or a cluster, the
user operations are performed. Unit tests for the user
operations for clusters are also added.

Implements blueprint: cluster-user-management

Change-Id: Ic6367bae2f2cf8f3cfea4b858376e1073d8b6fbc

commit_message:
Add scheduler_hints attributes to create_instance

This change adds scheduler_hints to create_instance.
scheduler_hints help users to make some advices for
nova schedulers.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint: add-scheduler-hints

This will also prevent undesired files.

commit_message:
Use datastore specific timeouts if they exists

Reasons:
- If one taskmanager is managing multiple datastores it becomes
  mandatory to setup the usage_timeout/cluster_usage_timeout
  to be the highest value to accommodate highest time-taking datastore.

Changes:
- Updates taskamanager to use datastore-specific usage_timeout,
  if one exists, otherwise use the default one.
- Updates mongodb and vertica cluster strategies to use
  datastore-specific cluster_usage_timeout, if one exists,
  otherwise use the default one.
- Updated usage_timeout from mysql and percona confs to be 600,
  as the integration tests do not work with previous value of 400 seconds.

Closes-Bug: #1432558
Closes-Bug: #1469989
Change-Id: If78dead1ea013ed7a807b4a9327056092ff7012a

Stop using nova client in test_compute

The test_compute functional test code was using nova client
directly instead of the shade API. Let's avoid that.

commit_message:
User management for Vertica clusters and instances

As the spec specifies, changes were made to
enable user CRUD operations for Vertica clusters
and instances.

To associate a user with a cluster, changes to the
user api. The previous UserController was replaced
with a DatastoreUserController interface that the
VerticaUserController and the MySQLUserController
both implement. The interface has methods for
managing users on both instances and clusters.

Change-Id: I21ebdc8e6ae896ad8241ad296fbb07db862cfd72
Implements blueprint: cluster-user-management

commit_message:
Custom Flavors For Config Servers and Routers

adds configurations for setting config-server flavor as well
as the query-router flavor for mongodb clusters. prior to this
patch, the routers and config-servers would inherit the flavor
chosen for the instances, which is an extremely inefficient
use of resources.

Change-Id: Iac0803401c30141f5e9d9544bf982597647092d9
Implements: blueprint clustering-sizing

This patch starts to move Trove usage of Heat to native Heat templates

- use native HOT functions to resolve resources and parameters

commit_message:
Use native Heat template format and resources

This patch starts to move Trove usage of Heat to native Heat templates
and OpenStack resources.

Changes include:
- use native HOT syntax for the template
- use native HOT functions to resolve resources and parameters
- use native OpenStack volume and volume attachment resources
- use native OpenStack server resource

As a consequence of the latter, Trove images no longer should require
heat-cfntools package, boot config is done purely via cloud-init.
*Warning* - the default login name to the instance might no longer
be 'ec2-user' and depends on actual cloud image used.

The resources left untouched are security group and floating ip plus
association as currently in Heat only those AWS-compat resources
support both Nova-network and Neutron backends transparently.

Change-Id: I9bcdf234ccd3881f1ab836542c689da44d592e1c
Implements: blueprint native-os-heat-resources

commit_message:
Add instance metadata functionality to trove

Instance metadata is a feature that has been requested frequently by
Trove users. They need a way to store critical information for their
instances and have that be associated with the instance so that it is
displayed whenever that instance is listed via the API.

This also becomes very usable from a testing perspective when doing
integration/CI. The metadata can be utilized to store things like what
process created the instance, what the instance is being used for, etc.

The following calls have been implemented to facilitate metadata
support:

  create
  delete
  list
  show
  edit
  update

Implements: blueprint trove-metadata

Author: Daniel Salinas <imsplitbit@gmail.com>

Co-Authored-By: Joe Cruz <joe.cruz@rackspace.com>
Co-Authored-By: Denis Makogon <dmakogon@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Peter Stachowski <peter@tesora.com>

Change-Id: I1925b58b0ead307babe57d0ee28dcb5449fd6ce5

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-06-02 10:48:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix poll_until retriever when heat provisioning is enabled

Reasons:
 - When instance is being launched Trove-Taskmanager tries
   to define Trove instance status and Compute Instance status.
   But if heat provisioning is enabled, Trove should check status
   of its Instance and status of Stack, because checking status of
   Compute instance only is not enough, since Stack contains
   more than one resource.
 - Since taskmanager waiting for stack status
   'CREATE_COMPLETE'/'CREATE_FAILED' at provisioning,
   no need to pull Compute Instance status inside method
   _service_is_active method.
   Just need to poll Trove Instance status.

Changes:
 - splitting _service_is_active into:
   - trove_instance_is_active;
   - _compute_instance_is_active.
 - updating poll_intil retriever when heat provisioning enabled.

Change-Id: I63cfde596c15208563640d199f1d4a50bc1db668
Closes-Bug: #1325512

", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2014-06-18 08:58:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix poll_until retriever when heat provisioning is enabled

Reasons:
 - When instance is being launched Trove-Taskmanager tries
   to define Trove instance status and Compute Instance status.
   But if heat provisioning was enabled, Trove should check status
   of its Instance only since _create_server_volume_heat finishes
   with stack that's already in appropriate state - no need to check
   Compute Instance status at all.
 - Since taskmanager waiting for stack status
   'CREATE_COMPLETE'/'CREATE_FAILED' at provisioning,
   no need to pull Compute Instance status inside poll_until, because
   for heat-based provisioning is enough to poll
   and verify Instance Service status.

Changes:
 - extracting Trove instance retriever from _service_is_active into:
   - _check_trove_instance_is_in_valid_state;
 - updating poll_intil retriever when heat provisioning enabled.

Change-Id: I63cfde596c15208563640d199f1d4a50bc1db668
Closes-Bug: #1325512
", 'number': 3}, {'created': '2014-06-19 09:14:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix poll_until retriever when heat provisioning is enabled

Reasons:
 - When instance is being launched Trove-Taskmanager tries
   to define Trove instance status and Compute Instance status.
   But if heat provisioning was enabled, Trove should check status
   of its Instance only since _create_server_volume_heat finishes
   with stack that's already in appropriate state - no need to check
   Compute Instance status at all.
 - Since taskmanager waiting for stack status
   'CREATE_COMPLETE'/'CREATE_FAILED' at provisioning,
   no need to pull Compute Instance status inside poll_until, because
   for heat-based provisioning is enough to poll
   and verify Instance Service status.

Changes:
 - removing _service_is_active method;
 - splitting _service_is_active into:
   - _check_trove_instance_is_active;
   - _check_compute_instance_is_active.
 - updating _create_server method to poll compute instance status
   until it's ACTIVE or fail with appropriate exception;
 - updating poller to ask only for Trove instance status after
   stack/instance was created and in ACTIVE state.

Change-Id: I63cfde596c15208563640d199f1d4a50bc1db668
Closes-Bug: #1325512

 - updating _create_server method to poll compute instance status
   until it's ACTIVE or fail with appropriate exception;
 - updating poller to ask only for Trove instance status after
   stack/instance was created and in ACTIVE state.

   Compute Instance status at all.
 - Since taskmanager waiting for stack status
   'CREATE_COMPLETE'/'CREATE_FAILED' at provisioning,
   no need to pull Compute Instance status inside poll_until, because
   for heat-based provisioning is enough to poll
   and verify Instance Service status;
 - Taskmanager should block following provisioning
    steps of received compute instance is not ACTIVE.

Changes:
 - removing _service_is_active method;
 - splitting _service_is_active into:
   - _check_trove_instance_is_active;
   - _check_compute_instance_is_active.
 - updating _create_server method to poll compute instance status
   until it's ACTIVE or fail with appropriate exception;
 - updating poller to ask only for Trove instance status after
   stack/instance was created and in ACTIVE state.
 - _verify_compute_instance_is_active method was added to:
   - _create_server_volume;
   - _create_server_volume_individually;

Change-Id: I63cfde596c15208563640d199f1d4a50bc1db668

commit_message:
Fix poll_until retriever while creating an instance

Reasons:
 - When instance is being launched Trove-Taskmanager tries
   to define Trove instance status and Compute Instance status.
   But if heat provisioning was enabled, Trove should check status
   of its Instance only since _create_server_volume_heat finishes
   with stack that's already in appropriate state - no need to check
   Compute Instance status at all.
 - Since taskmanager waiting for stack status
   'CREATE_COMPLETE'/'CREATE_FAILED' at provisioning,
   no need to pull Compute Instance status inside poll_until, because
   for heat-based provisioning is enough to poll
   and verify Instance Service status;
 - Taskmanager should block following provisioning
    steps of received compute instance is not ACTIVE.

Changes:
 - removing _service_is_active method;
 - splitting _service_is_active into:
   - _check_trove_instance_is_active;
   - _check_compute_instance_is_active.
 - updating _create_server method to poll compute instance status
   until it's ACTIVE or fail with appropriate exception;
 - updating poller to ask only for Trove instance status after
   stack/instance was created and in ACTIVE state.
 - _verify_compute_instance_is_active method was added to:
   - _create_server_volume;
   - _create_server_volume_individually;

Change-Id: I63cfde596c15208563640d199f1d4a50bc1db668
Closes-Bug: #1325512

[{'created': '2014-12-16 12:35:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Corrects error message for user-access-revoke

Reasons:
- Before revoking the requested access, current code checks whether
  the user has the intended access.
- However, if the user does not have the needful access, the service
  prompts the wrong message to user, that database does not exists.

Changes:
- Adds the new exception for correct messaging.
- Updated the code to raise the new exception.
- Added unit tests to check the new code for correct & errorful execution.

commit_message:
Corrects error message for user-access-revoke

Reasons:
- Before revoking the requested database access, current code checks
  whether user has intended access, in the absence of which, service
  prompts the wrong message to user, that database does not exists.
- The error is raised as HTTP 422, unprocessable.

Changes:
- Added new HTTP 422 access forbidden exception to
  inform the lack of access.
- Unit-tests added.
- Integration test updated to verify HTTP-422.

Change-Id: Ifc3010c20324e05a002f674865150c96c331fde3
Closes-Bug: #1302405

commit_message:
Add datastore version and type to backup-list and backup-show

The backup-show and backup-list commands do not show the datastore type
and version, this patch includes it in the list.

Change-Id: I7ca912fa04df94126f509e85e9631d1be1ccaf13
Closes-Bug: #1340367

commit_message:
Readonly functional tests in trove CLI

This patch implements readonly functional tests using trove CLI.
All the unit tests are moved to "unit" directory under "tests" directory.
Functional tests are under "functional" directory under "tests".
Implements: blueprint functional-test-coverage
Depends-On: I60812c49577948bf1bb8a55bbea321e5690f0954
Change-Id: I2d439fa44c686837c9924f154ed5f0d03f6ce911

commit_message:
Adding licensing support for clusters and instances

Introducing licensing support by creating a separate
top level resource for licenses. This would allow
users to BYOL (bring your own license) and to associate
licenses with a particular datastore version.

Change-Id: Ia8b5f920fcc48df0de5dab52166aeab38b67d2a2
Blueprint: trove-license-installation

commit_message:
Make Rsync For Guest Optional

add additional elements in trove-integration to stage the trove code
and trove-guestagent.conf for the guest in the extra-data.d hook, and
subsequently install them in the install.d hook, vs. relying on
upstart/systemd to rsync it.

Change-Id: I960c4cf415ca427df07c48865f1ebc9e20a548a9
Implements: blueprint rsync-optional

The PGSQL_CONFIG and PSQL_HBA_CONFIG values need specific
assignment for the 'redhat' family (CentOS, RHEL, Fedora).

commit_message:
Support CentOS in postgresql config.py path

The PGSQL_CONFIG and PSQL_HBA_CONFIG values need specific
assignment for the 'redhat' family (CentOS, RHEL, Fedora).
The locations of those conf files are defaulted to their
normal location after a call to initdb (/var/lib/pgsql/data).

Change-Id: Ib27f1052291f3ef57e967db7393e70821a7e350e
Closes-Bug: #1442387

subject: Adds guest-exception-handler to resize-volume
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-08 10:25:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Adds guest-exception-handler to resize-volume

- In the absence of the exception handler block in resize-volume-execute method,
  the trove guest was not returning to it original state
  in case of a failure of any guest-methods,
  like if stop_db fails instance gets stuck in resize state.

- Adds the exception handler block to handle any GuestError.
- Removes the status checking block from the same method,
  as there was no purpose of this part because instance is pre-validated
  before sending a resize call for its "ACTIVE" state,
  in simple words, if instance status was not "ACTIVE"
  code will not flow till this point.

Change-Id: I538513552531f6d302c037b3ae9a315e6bbe2008
Closes-Bug: #1441558
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-04-08 11:12:29.000000000', 'files': ['trove/taskmanager/models.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/taskmanager/test_models.py'], 'message': 'Adds guest-exception-handler to resize-volume

commit_message:
Adds guest-exception-handler to resize-volume

- In the absence of the exception handler block in resize-volume-execute
  method, the trove guest was not returning to it original state
  in case of a failure of any guest-methods,
  like if stop_db fails instance gets stuck in resize state.

- Adds the exception handler block to handle any GuestError.
- Removes the status checking block from the same method,
  as there was no purpose of this part because instance is pre-validated
  before sending a resize call for its "ACTIVE" state,
  in simple words, if instance status was not "ACTIVE"
  code will not flow till this point.
- Removes the test which was testing the execute method raising exception
  when called with an instance in ERROR state.

Change-Id: I538513552531f6d302c037b3ae9a315e6bbe2008
Closes-Bug: #1441558

commit_message:
add client management support

Right now the client does not support mgmt api.
So add code to support them. We now support quota,
management, mgmt_cluster, accounts, mgmt_config_params.

Change-Id: I521f1bdc7b83c408e2d38a18296b519b4e24d843
Closes-Bug: #1250258
